This cyberattack disrupts the agency's operations, preventing employees from accessing the files necessary for court hearings and probation monitoring of young offenders.
title: Florida juvenile justice systems offline after hacker break-in

summary: Omni Hotels & Resorts' computer systems suffered a nationwide outage since Friday, affecting reservations, hotel room door locks and point-of-sale (POS) systems. The company is working to restore offline systems, but has not yet communicated the cause of the incident, although the nature and extent of the disruption suggests it could be a cyberattack.
title: Omni Hotels experiencing nationwide IT outage since Friday

summary: The East Baton Rouge Sheriff's Office suffered an attempted cyberattack where hackers managed to obtain a small amount of data, including screenshots of records and images of video files. In response, the office has increased its network security and is working with state and federal partners to investigate the incident. The Medusa ransomware group has claimed responsibility for the attack and is threatening to release more information, including sensitive files, if a $300,000 ransom is not paid in less than nine days.
title: Data obtained in East Baton Rouge Sheriff's cyber attack | Crime/Police | theadvocate.com

summary: The Torre Pacheco City Hall was the victim of a ransomware cyberattack on March 29, which compromised information systems and could affect residents' personal data. The mayor responded by informing the relevant authorities and setting up a crisis committee, while calling for unity in the face of the threat of cybercriminals. Precautionary measures are recommended for residents when communicating with the City Hall, and a notification has been sent to the Spanish Data Protection Agency.
title: ! Murcia Today - Torre Pacheco Town Hall Suffers Cyber Attack Which Could Affect Personal Info For Residents

summary: The Medusa ransomware group claimed responsibility for a cyberattack on Traverse City area public schools, leading to the cancellation of classes in early April, after allegedly stealing 1.2 TB of data and demanding a total of $1 million to not disclose the data and decrypt it. School district management, along with a third-party cybersecurity firm, police and the FBI, are investigating the incident with no reports so far of identity theft or fraud related to the attack. Medusa is known for its double extortion technique and has previously targeted other school districts, exploiting vulnerabilities to maximize payments from
title: Ransomware Group Claims It Targeted Traverse City Schools

victim: Programme des Nations Unies pour le développement (PNUD)
summary: The United Nations Development Program (UNDP) was the victim of a cyberattack in late March 2024, targeting its IT infrastructure in Copenhagen and resulting in the theft of sensitive data related to human resources and procurement. In response, UNDP took immediate steps to isolate the affected server, assess the extent of the compromised data and notify affected individuals, while committing to maintaining transparent communication with its partners and affected parties.
title: Cyberattack On UNDP Breaches HR And Procurement Data

summary: Palau's financial management system was severely disrupted by a ransomware cyberattack, the first of its kind against the Palau government, forcing the Ministry of Finance to process salaries manually. President Surangel Whipps Jr. suspects the attack came from a company in Malaysia with possible ties to Russia or China. Faced with this threat, he stressed the importance of a comprehensive cybersecurity plan and requested help from the United States and Taiwan.
title: Palau scrambles after cyberattack cripples financial systems | Regional / World | Marianas Variety News & Views

summary: Unimed VTRP, a medical cooperative, was the victim of a cyberattack on the morning of Tuesday 26, which disrupted its services without a precise estimate of the resumption of normal operations being available. The organization's technical and administrative teams are working to resolve the issue and mitigate the impacts on customers and partners. In response to the incident, Unimed VTRP established an emergency telephone number for cases requiring immediate medical assistance.
title: Cyber ​​attack paralyzes Unimed VTRP services this Tuesday

summary: Gilmer County, Georgia was hit by a ransomware attack that resulted in the interruption of several services, although essential services, including 911, remain operational. County officials are working with federal law enforcement and cybersecurity consultants to investigate the incident and restore affected services.
title: Gilmer County reports ransomware attack | 11alive.com

summary: The city of St. Cloud was the victim of a ransomware cyberattack, but continues to provide its public services with adjustments, including emergency services which remain fully operational. Payments for some facilities and services, such as the transfer station and parks and recreation, are cash only at this time. The city is working to resolve the issue and maintaining communication with the community for future updates.
title: City of St. Cloud Responds to Ransomware Cyberattack

summary: The University of Winnipeg suffered a cyberattack over the weekend, shutting down its systems to prevent further damage, but no personal information was leaked. Classes were canceled on Monday, but resumed on Tuesday with Wi-Fi restored, while the university works to restore online services, with the goal of having some critical services back up and running by next week. As a result, the semester and exam period have been extended by one week to allow for the full overhaul of systems for students and staff.
title: University of Winnipeg working on restoring services following cyber attack | CTV News

summary: Intermarché's Mestdagh supermarkets suffered a cyberattack last Sunday, causing supply problems in certain stores. The attack targeted internal control systems, with a ransom demand from the cybercriminals. Intermarché reported a limited impact and quickly restored the system, without entering personal data. Despite everything, some stores have experienced difficulties with orders and deliveries, with occasional empty shelves.
title: Cyberattack on Intermarché stores in Mestdagh - RetailDetail BE

summary: Stock brokerage firm VNDirect fell victim to a cyberattack on Sunday, but managed to overcome the attack on Monday morning, although its website remained inaccessible. The attack began at 10 a.m. on Sunday and, according to a company spokesperson, the issues have been resolved and the process of resuming trading is underway, but this could take time.
title: Brokerage VNDirect faces cyberattack - VnExpress International

summary: Ariza Credit Union in Granada suffered a cyberattack that resulted in an interruption of its services. The credit union has taken the precautionary step of disconnecting its IT systems until Tuesday, March 26, affecting in-branch services, ATMs, online services and point-of-sale services. It is working to quickly restore normal operations and has apologized for the inconvenience caused.
title: Credit Union suffers cyberattack in Grenada | Loop Caribbean News

summary: Panera Bread Company suffered a week-long IT outage due to a ransomware attack, which encrypted many of the company's virtual machines, preventing access to data and applications. No ransomware group has claimed responsibility for the attack, and Panera has not communicated about the incident, raising concerns among employees about the company's transparency and the security of their data. The attack led to major disruptions, including the inability to process electronic payments and access loyalty program systems, affecting operations at the company's 2,160 cafes.
title: Panera Bread week-long IT outage caused by ransomware attack

summary: Cressex Community School was the victim of a cyber attack on Friday March 22, affecting its IT systems. The school implemented its cyber incident response plan and continued to operate as normal, while engaging with specialists and informing the ICO in accordance with GDPR. Measures have been taken to limit the loss of data and restore IT systems, and the incident is being investigated by the relevant authorities.
title: High Wycombe Cressex Community School hit by cyber attack | Bucks Free Press

summary: The Tarrant Appraisal District was the victim of a ransomware attack, confirmed after their website was down for several hours. The incident has been reported to the FBI and the Texas Department of Information Resources, but it is not yet clear whether any sensitive information was compromised. The ransom amount demanded and the identity of the hacker group responsible have not been disclosed, and an emergency board meeting is planned to discuss the attack.
title: Tarrant Appraisal District says it is victim of ransomware attack

summary: Listed company Nampak has informed its shareholders that it was the victim of a cyber attack where third parties accessed its IT systems. Nampak has taken steps to contain and assess the incident, and is working with cybersecurity experts to restore the integrity of its systems, clarifying that its manufacturing operations are not affected. An initial notification has been lodged with the Information Regulator under the Protection of Personal Information Act (Popia), and notification to potentially affected individuals will be made in accordance with Popia's requirements.
title: Nampak hit by cyberattack - TechCentral

summary: The Goed network of pharmacies and home care stores, owned by CM, was the victim of a cyberattack where data was stolen and encrypted. Goed's systems have been taken offline to prevent further action by hackers, and the company is working with cybersecurity experts to assess the extent of the data breach and the possibility of a ransom demand. Despite the attack, Goed stores remain open, but are experiencing difficulties with bancontact payments and access to digital prescriptions, and a plan to restart the systems is being developed.
title: Healthcare retailer Good target of cyber attack | Domestic | hln.be

summary: Henry County, Illinois was hit by a ransomware cyberattack on March 18, affecting several of its systems, but emergency services like 911 remain operational. The Medusa ransomware group has claimed responsibility for the attack and is demanding a $500,000 ransom, with a history of attacks against various organizations around the world. Separately, nearby Monmouth College also suffered a ransomware attack over the holiday season, affecting the personal data of 44,737 people.
title: Illinois county government, local college affected by ransomware attacks

summary: Unimed Cuiabá suffered a cyberattack on the night of Monday, March 18, resulting in the temporary unavailability of its computerized system for releasing medical care requests. Despite the attack, personal and sensitive data was not compromised, and no care was interrupted thanks to the implementation of manual procedures. The cooperative is actively working to restore the system and ensures that services to customers will be maintained without prejudice.
title: Unimed Cuiabá reports cyber attack and measures to guarantee customer service | The Good News

summary: The Whitko Community Schools district suffered an outage of its computer system in March 2024, initially attributed to a power supply problem, but ultimately identified as a ransomware attack. No evidence of sensitive data theft was found and the district did not pay a ransom. Additional security measures are being put in place to prevent such attacks in the future.
title: Statement regarding the March 2024 IT systems outage - Whitko Community Schools

summary: Polycab's IT infrastructure was targeted by a ransomware attack on March 17, 2024, but the company said its core systems and operations were not affected. The company's systems are currently operating normally, all factories are operational and Polycab continues to serve its customers, with an internal technical team and external cybersecurity experts actively analyzing the incident. At the same time, the company had a difficult start to the year in 2024 following alleged tax search operations on its premises, but denied any tax evasion and its shares rose 1.27%.
title: Polycab IT infrastructure targeted by ransomware attack, company says core systems and operations not impacted

summary: The South China Athletic Association was the victim of a cyberattack on Sunday March 17, leading to a possible compromise of the personal data of some 70,000 individuals, including names, dates of birth, identification numbers and addresses. The association responded by shutting down affected IT equipment and informing the police and the Privacy Commissioner, while activating an emergency plan to notify affected members. The Commissioner has started an investigation into the incident and urged those affected to come forward if they suspect a leak of their personal data.
title: South China Athletic Association hit by cyber-attack | The Standard

summary: The city of Pensacola suffered a potential cyberattack over the weekend, affecting its non-emergency phone system, but not impacting emergency services like police and fire. Other essential departments, such as the Port and Pensacola International Airport, are operating normally. The incident is under investigation and the city has set up alternate telephone numbers for services affected by the outage.
title: Pensacola appears to suffer cyberattack over the weekend

summary: Void Interactive, the developer of the 2023 FPS game Ready Or Not, was the victim of a cyberattack resulting in the leak of 4TB of data, including the source code of the game and previous versions, as well as data on the console versions . This leak, considered one of the most important in video game history, surpasses that of Insomniac Games from the previous year. Despite the scale of the leak, there have been no reports of personal information being compromised, and Void Interactive has yet to officially acknowledge the attack.
title: Ready or Not Developer Void Interactive Hit by Massive 4TB Data Breach

summary: Heinrich-Heine-Universität Düsseldorf was the victim of a cyberattack in March, during which data was accessed and partially downloaded, including information on around 15,000 students and more than 60,000 university identifiers. The attackers exploited stolen access to gain access to the online exam system and another set of data, but there was no manipulation of exam results. The enhanced security implemented by the university allowed the attack to be quickly detected, compromised access blocked and measures taken to prevent further damage, and a complaint was filed.
title: Hacker attack: Düsseldorf’s Heinrich Heine University attacked again

summary: Diabetes WA was the victim of a cyberattack which allowed a third party to access the personal information of some of its contacts, but no detailed medical data was accessed. The incident was quickly detected, contained and investigated according to the organization's cybersecurity response plan. Diabetes WA has advised affected individuals to replace their Medicare card number and provided recommendations to protect themselves against identity fraud, while offering a contact for further information or assistance.
title: Notification of Privacy Incident | Diabetes WA

summary: Trifyl, in Tarn, faced an attempted cyber attack on Friday March 15. IT teams quickly detected the incident and responded promptly. To counter the attack, they disconnected all computers from the network.
title: Tarn - Trifyl foils an attempted cyberattack and nearly causes a computer disaster | Le Journal d'Ici

summary: The community of communes of Nuits-Saint-Georges was paralyzed by a cyberattack on Friday, March 15, 2024, leading to the intervention of the Regional Cybersecurity Center CSIRT-Bourgogne-Franche-Comté to restore services, a process that should take a few more days. The telephone lines were restored, but the hackers demanded a ransom after targeting the community by chance, exploiting its cybersecurity deemed fragile. The town hall of Nuits-Saint-Georges, already the victim of a similar attack in 2019, had since reinforced its security and is not affected by this new attack.
title: The community of communes of Nuits-Saint-Georges target of a violent cyberattack, a ransom demanded

summary: The Deutsches Meeresmuseum in Stralsund was the target of a cyberattack, making it impossible to buy tickets online via the museum's website. Visitors can still access the Ozeaneum and Natureum museum sites during normal hours, but tickets can only be purchased with cash on site. The museum reported the incident to the police, and although communications with visitors are disrupted, previously purchased tickets remain valid.
title: Cyber ​​attack on maritime museum in Stralsund

summary: The multinational Fujitsu has confirmed that it has been the victim of a cyberattack, revealing that malware was detected on several of the company's computers and that personal data and customer information may have been stolen. The company has disconnected the affected devices from its network and is investigating to determine the extent of the data breach.
title: Tech large Fujitsu says it was hacked, warns of information breach - Tech Gate

summary: On March 14, 2024, Radiant Logistics, Inc. detected the early stages of a cyberattack related to its Canadian operations and immediately activated its incident response protocols. Steps were taken to isolate Canadian operations and engage cybersecurity professionals to assess and remediate the situation. Although this has caused service delays in Canada, systems recovery efforts are expected to be largely completed in the coming week, with no major impact on the company's overall operations.
title: Material Cybersecurity Incidents

summary: The Scranton School District in Pennsylvania is facing a ransomware attack that caused widespread technology outages, confirmed in a message to students on Friday. The district's schools, which serve about 10,000 students, are working with cyberforensics specialists to investigate and restore affected systems, which has forced students to use paper and pencils for homework. This attack is the 21st confirmed attack on a school district in 2024, and follows other similar incidents in New Jersey and other states, as well as data thefts and ransom payments
title: Pennsylvania’s Scranton School District dealing with ransomware attack

summary: NHS Dumfries and Galloway has been the victim of an ongoing targeted cyber attack, putting a significant amount of potentially identifiable patient and staff data at risk. The health department is working with Police Scotland, the National Cyber ​​Security Center and the Scottish Government to resolve the breach of its systems. Disruptions to services are expected and a dedicated web page has been set up to inform about the attack.
title: NHS Dumfries and Galloway hit by cyber attack with patient and staff data at risk | UK News | Sky News

summary: Malaysian company Maxis was targeted by a cyberattack carried out by international hacker group R00TK1T, but the attack did not result in a leak of personal data according to the Personal Data Protection Authority (JPDP). The Minister of Digital informed Parliament that only the system of one store or subsidiary was affected, and this system was independent of Maxis' main systems. Malaysian authorities, including the JPDP, the Malaysian Cybersecurity Agency and the National Cybersecurity Agency (NACSA), will continue to monitor the security of the country's digital infrastructure and collaborate with regulators.
title: Maxis hacked by international hacker group | Malaysia See Hua Daily News Network

summary: The Riverview School District reported a security incident affecting teachers' access to the internet and electronic devices, but the exact nature of the problem remains undetermined. The authorities have taken precautionary measures and are continuing their investigations.
title: Riverview School District latest to be hit with online security incident

summary: The president of the Instituto Hondureño del Transporte Terrestre (IHTT), Rafael Barahona, announced that the institution was the victim of a cyberattack more than a month ago, leading to the filing of complaints with the Cyber ​​Crimes Unit . They managed to backup and migrate all the data to the cloud with emergency help from Huawei, which provided three months of hosting. Barahona stressed that this attack, demanding a ransom to restore the systems, represents a new form of crime also affecting Honduras.
title: The IHTT is a “victim” of cyber attack, reveals commissioner - Diario La Tribuna

summary: Scullion Law, with offices in Scotland and Madrid, was the victim of a cyberattack by Russian ransomware operator Black Basta, resulting in the theft of 155 gigabytes of data. The firm responded by informing the ICO, the Law Society of Scotland, working with the police and external experts, and notifying affected individuals, while remaining operational. Jude McCorry, CEO of the Cyber ​​and Fraud Center – Scotland, has expressed concern about the recent wave of cyber attacks in Scotland and called for better cyber resilience.
title: Scullion LAW becomes victim of cyberattack | Scottish Legal News

summary: The District of North Vancouver was the target of a ransomware attack earlier this week, but the attack was quickly detected and stopped, with little impact to public services and no loss of residents’ personal data. No ransom was paid and affected systems were largely restored by the Tuesday following the attack. An investigation is underway by cybersecurity consultants to review the incident.
title: District of North Vancouver victim of ransomware attack - North Shore News

summary: A Graz-based IT provider that manages around 80 databases for real estate companies was the victim of a cyberattack last weekend, which may have led to an extensive data leak. The customer database of Klagenfurt Wohnen, a city-owned landlord, could be affected, according to research by Kleine Zeitung. The extent of the damage caused by the allegedly criminal intrusion into the servers of the IT company hired by the city of Klagenfurt's real estate subsidiary is not yet clear, said Valentin Unterkircher, the city's communications chief.
title: Sensitive data: Cyber ​​attack on Graz IT company that manages customer data of Klagenfurt Wohnen

summary: MarineMax, one of the world's largest boat sellers, reported to the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) a cyberattack that disrupted its operations, which began on Sunday. The company implemented its incident response and business continuity protocols, resulting in disruptions, but continued to operate and hired cybersecurity experts to investigate. MarineMax did not confirm whether any data was stolen, but indicated that sensitive data was not stored in the IT environment affected by the incident, and the material impact on the company's operations remains to be seen. determine.
title: Billion-dollar boat seller MarineMax reports cyberattack to SEC

summary: The town of Huntsville, Ontario, closed its municipal office for the second day in a row and postponed some council meetings due to an investigation into a cybersecurity incident detected over the weekend. The municipality implemented its incident response protocol and took steps to protect its network, although no evidence of sensitive data compromise was found. The incident in Huntsville is the second such incident reported in an Ontario municipality in the past three weeks, following a similar attack in Hamilton on February 25.
title: Second Ontario municipality reports cybersecurity incident within three weeks | CTV News

summary: Belgian telecommunications company edpnet was the victim of a cyberattack that gave unauthorized individuals access to its administrative systems, but the company says no data was stolen and that network connectivity services customers were not affected. As a result of the attack, customers are currently unable to log into their accounts, and edpnet has strengthened the security of its systems and is working with cybersecurity experts.
title: Edpnet disables customer login systems after cyber attack, no data stolen - Computer - News - Tweakers

summary: Leicester City Council has shut down some of its IT systems following a cybersecurity incident. Richard Sword, strategic director of urban and neighborhood developments, confirmed this preventive measure. This action follows similar incidents which have affected several other local authorities in recent months.
title: Leicester City Council systems shut down after 'cyber incident' - BBC News

summary: Kärntner Landesversicherung (KLV), an Austrian insurance company, was the target of a cyberattack over the weekend, but thanks to its alarm system, damage was largely avoided and customer data was not compromised. were probably not affected. However, temporary restrictions on online services are expected for the company's 70,000 customers. Cybersecurity experts emphasize the importance of having effective, network-disconnected data backups to quickly recover from such an attack.
title: Cyber ​​attack on KLV without major damage - kaernten.ORF.at

summary: On April 30, 2024, Panda Express notified the Maine Attorney General of a cyberattack that occurred between March 7 and 11, 2024, which allowed an unauthorized party to access sensitive consumer information. Following an investigation with the assistance of data security experts, Panda Express began sending data breach notification letters to affected individuals. Panda Group, Inc., owner of Panda Express, is a restaurant group founded in 1973, operating more than 2,300 restaurants and generating approximately $4.5 billion in annual revenue.
title: Panda Express Issues Data Breach Letters Following March 2024 Cyberattack | Console and Associates, P.C. - JDSupra

summary: The social landlord Opheor was the victim of two computer attacks on March 7. The confidential data stored by the lessor has not been stolen. A complaint has been filed.
title: Loire. Roanne: the social landlord Opheor victim of a computer attack

summary: The Beyers Koffie company has been the victim of a cyberattack, following a similar incident which affected the Duvel-Moortgat brewery earlier in the week. Production at Duvel-Moortgat had to be stopped as a result of the attack. The exact repercussions of the attack on Beyers Koffie are not yet known.
title: Beyers Koffie now also a victim of cyber attack | RTV

summary: The Administradora de Subsidios Sociales (ADESS) of the Dominican Republic was the victim of a cyberattack by the criminal group “Blackcat”, which temporarily affected its operational systems. The rapid intervention of IT security teams, in collaboration with various national cybersecurity authorities, helped protect data and ensure business continuity. Despite the attack, ADESS assures that the social grant payment schedule will not be disrupted and encourages beneficiaries to continue to participate in operations to replace magnetic cards with smart cards.
title: Social Subsidies (ADESS) reports cyber attack on its Data Center

summary: The city of Birmingham, Alabama, suffered a cyberattack, identified as a ransomware incident, that disrupted its government services since March 6, forcing the municipality to revert to manual processes like using worksheets. time paper to record employee working hours. Although emergency services such as 911, police and fire were not affected, other services such as payroll, taxation, permits and licensing were impacted, with repercussions for businesses and citizens seeking permits.
title: Paper-Based Payments Continue in Cyber-Struck Birmingham

summary: The Nisqually Red Wind Casino temporarily closed its doors March 6 and 7 following a cyberattack that took its servers offline, according to an announcement on their Facebook page. Although ATMs were functioning and tribal employee and team checks could be cashed, credit or debit card transactions were unavailable. The casino has reissued the missed free play offers and is working to restore all services, but has not updated its Facebook announcement since the morning of the Tuesday before the article.
title: Nisqually Red Wind Casino temporarily closes after cyber attack | Nisqually Valley News

summary: The Duvel Moortgat brewery, located in Breendonk, was the victim of a ransomware cyberattack, leading to the shutdown of all its activities. IT alarms went off at 1:30 a.m. and production was immediately suspended, with an uncertain resumption planned perhaps for the next day or the day after that. The brewery not only produces the famous Duvel beer, but also Vedett and Maredsous beers, and it is not yet clear whether the other Duvel Moortgat sites have been affected, although the brewery has sufficient stock to handle the 'production shutdown.
title: Duvel Moortgat Brewery victim of cyber attack: all activities in Breendonk stopped (Puurs-Sint-Amands) | The newspapaer

summary: Dermatology practices in New Jersey were victims of a cyberattack, resulting in a leak of personal information. The details of the incident are not yet clear, but authorities are investigating the matter. Affected patients should take steps to protect their identity and monitor their accounts.
title: NJ dermatologist offices hit by cyberattack on personal info

summary: South St. Paul Public Schools reported an ongoing technology disruption due to unauthorized activity in their computer network. They took their systems offline to isolate the problem and hired a cybersecurity company to investigate and restore the systems. The district is now focused on restoring services and maintaining a productive learning environment for students and staff.
title: South St. Paul Public Schools investigating potential cybersecurity threat - Twin Cities

victim: FINTRAC (Financial Transactions and Reports Analysis Centre of Canada)
summary: Canada's financial intelligence agency, FINTRAC, was forced to take its corporate systems offline following a cybersecurity incident over the weekend. Although the nature of the incident was not revealed, the agency clarified that it did not involve its intelligence or classified systems and that it is working with its federal partners to protect and restore its systems.
title: Cyberattack forces Canada’s financial intelligence agency to take systems offline

summary: American Renal Associates (now known as Innovative Renal Care), which has more than 230 locations across the United States, has become the latest victim of a ransomware attack in the clinical-hospital sector. Recently, the Medusa Group made thousands of PHI and PII data stolen from the company's servers publicly available on its website.
title: American Renal Associates, nearly 20,000 patients are affected by the data breach

summary: Following a cyber incident, security and software company Hansab suffered significant disruption to its IT systems, but banking operations in Estonia, including ATMs, card payments and online banking, were not affected. not affected thanks to the rapid intervention of the Bank of Estonia. Hansab worked with the State Authority for Information Systems to quickly restore disrupted services, demonstrating the resilience of Estonia's banking infrastructure in the face of cyber threats.
title: Hansab Cyber Incident Disrupts IT Systems, Estonia's Banking Operations Remain Unaffected

victim: United Seating and Mobility, LLC d/b/a Numotion
summary: In April 2024, Numotion, a company specializing in the manufacturing of medical devices, announced that it had been the victim of a cyberattack between February 29 and March 2, 2024, allowing hackers to access sensitive consumer information, such as such as names, dates of birth, social security numbers and employment information. Following an investigation, Numotion began sending data breach notifications to affected individuals on April 15, 2024. Numotion, based in Brentwood, Tennessee, employs more than 2,800 people and generates approximately $701 million in annual revenue.
title: Numotion Announces Data Breach Stemming from March 2024 Cyberattack | Console and Associates, P.C. - JDSupra

summary: The Corporations and Intellectual Property Commission (CIPC) system in South Africa has been the target of a cyberattack, resulting in the compromise of personal data of customers and employees. CIPC ICT technicians quickly detected and isolated the threat, allowing affected systems to be restored, but personal information was exposed prior to intervention. CIPC has advised its customers to monitor their credit card transactions and is actively working to minimize the impact of this data exposure.
title: CIPC system latest victim of increasing cyber attacks

summary: Mediplast, a supplier of medical equipment to the Västerbotten region of Sweden, was the victim of a cyberattack, affecting the delivery of essential products used in surgical operations. The region has activated a state of emergency to monitor the situation and is evaluating the possibility of using other suppliers, while having sufficient stock to manage in the short term. Officials anticipate delivery issues could persist for several days, but do not see immediate challenges as long as current inventory is available.
title: Region Västerbotten in staff mode after cyber attack against supplier | SVT News

summary: Following an alleged hacker attack, the city of Bad Schwalbach (Rheingau-Taunus) has had its system taken offline. All internet connections have been disconnected as a precaution, and the city administration is currently only reachable by telephone and an external email account. "Anomalies" in an application were detected two weeks ago, and investigations have revealed a "security incident".
title: Hacker attack on city administration in Bad Schwalbach | hessenschau.de | Panorama

summary: Swiss toy retailer Franz Carl Weber suffered a cyberattack in February, orchestrated by hacker group Black Basta, which led to 700 gigabytes of data being leaked onto the darknet after the demanded ransom was not paid. The leaked data includes sensitive information of 200 employees, such as identity documents, banking details, medical certificates, HR assessments and information about their children. The Federal Data Protection Officer is aware of the incident and the affected employees have been informed.
title: The lives of Franz Carl Weber's employees leaked online - 20 minutes

summary: The Instituto para la Protection de Personas Defensoras de Derechos Humanos y Periodistas de Sinaloa condemned a ransomware attack against the newspaper El Debate, which occurred on Wednesday, February 28, which blocked access to virtual, backup and plan servers disaster recovery, affecting various operations except web operations. The Institute expressed its strong condemnation of this digital violence which threatens freedom of expression and press, essential to democracy, and demanded a rapid investigation to identify and punish those responsible. He also called for the protection of journalism and the defense of freedom
title: Institute for the Protection of Journalists condemns cyber attack against El Debate

summary: The University of Management and Technology (UMT) in Lahore has been hit by a ransomware cyberattack, compromising its online database and enterprise resource planning (ERP) system, leading to major disruptions to internal services. Despite efforts by staff to restore critical services, almost a month after the attack, systems remain inaccessible.
title: University of Management and Technology has been cyber-attacked Pi News | Pi News

summary: The Sidaction association, committed to the fight against AIDS, was the victim of a cyberattack which led to a violation of the personal data of certain donors, with a risk of disclosure of names, addresses, telephone numbers, donation amounts and IBAN/BIC bank details for around 3% of affected people. Bank card data is not affected by this leak. Sidaction informed the donors concerned, notified the CNIL and took measures to strengthen security with its service provider.
title: Cyberattack: Sidaction is concerned about possible theft of donors’ bank details

summary: A Bengaluru-based private construction company, BSR Infratech India Ltd, fell victim to a ransomware cyberattack on February 27, where hackers encrypted the company's data and demanded a payment of $80,000 for the key to decryption, threatening to sell the data on the dark web if their demands were not met. The incident was reported to police on March 28 following a period of verification by the company. The police have registered a case under Section 66 of the Information Technology Act (IT Act) and are currently investigating the attack.
title: Bengaluru Cyber crime news: Ransomware attack hits Bengaluru firm, criminals demand $80,000

summary: The Good Spirit School Division, which oversees 27 schools in west-central Saskatchewan, was the victim of a cyberattack on February 27, resulting in significant disruptions to its communications and internet systems, although students' personal data students remained secure because they are managed by an external system. This incident highlights the growing trend of cybersecurity threats targeting educational institutions and highlights the need for improved cybersecurity measures in the education sector.
title: Cyber-Attack on Good Spirit School Division Disrupts Operations, Student Data Safe

summary: The Mannheim district of the German Red Cross (DRK) was the victim of a cyberattack. According to the DRK in Mannheim, the attack took place on the night of February 27. A consequence of this attack is that telephone accessibility to the district as well as email contact are currently restricted.
title: Cyber ​​attack on German Red Cross district association Mannheim

summary: The Kempten University of Applied Sciences in Germany was the victim of a criminal cyberattack that forced the institution to deactivate its IT infrastructure. The attack blocked access to several computer systems and currently the university cannot be reached by email, although the telephone system is still working.
title: German applied sciences university announces being hit by criminal cyberattack

summary: The Regional Särskild sjukvårdsledning (RSSL) was activated in emergency management mode following a cyberattack on Sophiahemmet, a healthcare facility in Stockholm. As a result, certain safeguards have been put in place, affecting healthcare providers' access to the region's medical records system and other related systems, requiring them to adopt manual procedures temporarily. The region is closely monitoring developments and hopes to restore functionality to affected healthcare providers as soon as possible.
title: Regional special healthcare management due to cyber attack against Sophiahemmet - News - Region Stockholm

summary: Hundreds of Cambridge University researchers are blocked from accessing a computer system due to “malicious activity”. The incident was detected five weeks ago on the IT Service of the Clinical School, without proof of data theft. The university is working to restore the data and service.

title: Another California city, targeted by Ransomware hackers, cyber criminals disable city services | Golden Gate Media | NewsBreak Original
