title: Rebound Orthopedics & Neurosurgery Announces Data Breach Stemming from February 2024 Cyberattack | Console and Associates, P.C. - JDSupra

summary: Etesia, a company located in Wissembourg, was the target of a cyberattack. As a result of this attack, 160 employees of the company were placed on partial activity.
title: Wissembourg. Etesia victim of a cyberattack, 160 employees in partial activity

summary: Welch's confirmed Friday that a recent disruption to its system was due to a cyberattack. The attack occurred on February 2, leading to a disruption of operations and uncertainty about when work could resume. More than 100 technology and cybersecurity experts are working to restore systems, and the company is working with authorities to investigate the incident. Welch's continues to ship orders and expects production to resume soon.
title: Cyberattack targets Welch’s North East plant, investigation underway | WJET/WFXP/YourErie.com

summary: Korneuburg's Rathaus (town hall) was the victim of a cyberattack where all data was encrypted, including servers, client workstations and backup systems. An external company was hired to resolve the issue, and ransomware is suspected since a ransom message was received. In the meantime, municipal services remain accessible by telephone, although all digital operations are paralyzed.
title: Everything is encrypted: Cyber ​​attack on Korneuburg town hall - Korneuburg

victim: Hôpital de la Trinité à Lippstadt, ainsi que les cliniques associées à Erwitte et Geseke.
summary: A cyberattack paralyzed the Dreifaltigkeits-Hospital in Lippstadt as well as two associated clinics in Erwitte and Geseke, temporarily preventing the admission of emergency cases. Patients already present continue to receive comprehensive care and planned procedures are expected to resume during the day. Authorities are investigating to determine how cybercriminals gained access to the hospital group's computer network and assess the extent of the damage.
title: No emergency admissions in hospitals after cyber attack | Die Glocke

summary: Reykjavík University is recovering from a cyber attack believed to be orchestrated by the Russian hacker group Akira, known for using ransomware. While the attack was widespread, the university asserts that only basic information about the student body was accessed. Students and staff are advised to change passwords, especially if used elsewhere, and to remain cautious about potential phishing messages and emails. The university plans to resume classes on February 5th.
title: Russian Hackers Believed to be Behind Cyber Attack on Icelandic University

summary: The city of Germantown was the victim of a "malicious cybersecurity incident" that disrupted its IT systems, with the first alert reported just before 6 a.m. Friday. The attack was contained and appears to have affected a limited number of internal servers, while financial, utility and payment information systems, which are cloud-based, were not compromised. 911 emergency lines are operating, but some non-emergency services and city phone lines are impacted, and payments can still be made online or at City Hall.
title: Germantown hit by cybersecurity incident: Here's what we know

summary: Dataouest, a digital services company based in Saint-Lô, is organizing a round table on cybersecurity on April 4, 2024, following a cyberattack suffered by one of its clients, Fondouest, with Lockbit ransomware. The attack paralyzed the Fondouest company, blocking the computers of 65 employees and ten servers, and required the reconstruction of the entire network. The round table aims to share best practices in cybersecurity and raise awareness among companies of the importance of employee training, particularly in email management.
title: In Saint-Lô, this IT company is organizing a round table around cybersecurity | La Presse de la Manche

summary: Minnesota State University Moorhead (MSUM) suffered a more than two-week network outage due to a ransomware attack. The university's IT team discovered that some servers were encrypted and locked by the ransomware, but there is currently no indication that sensitive data such as Social Security or credit card numbers was compromised. The university is working to restore services and advises students and staff to take security measures, such as changing passwords regularly and using multi-factor authentication.
title: Network outage at MSUM caused by cyber attack

victim: Ajuntament de Sant Antoni de Portmany
summary: The Ajuntament de Sant Antoni de Portmany was the victim of a ransomware cyberattack which affected its municipal IT systems. The IT department has been working since the problem was detected at midnight to analyze the extent of the attack and its impact on municipal services, focusing on containing the attack and beginning recovery processes. Citizens are recommended to call before visiting in person to confirm the availability of services, and the incident is being communicated to the relevant agencies, including the Center Criptològic Nacional (CCN-CERT).
title: The Sant Antoni de Portmany City Council has suffered a 'ransomware' cyberattack that has affected the municipal computer systems - News - santantoni.net

summary: On February 2, 2024, Diagnostic Medical Systems Group (DMS Group), a medical imaging company, announced that it had been the target of a ransomware cyberattack. The company's IT teams, supported by a cybersecurity provider and government agencies, responded quickly to contain the attack, and it was confirmed that no healthcare data was compromised and that customer equipment was not affected. The attack was claimed on February 1, 2024 by the Cuba Group.
title: DMS GROUP: Interception of a cyber attack.

summary: Groton Public Schools experienced a district-wide internet outage Thursday, following a cyberattack on their main servers. Groton Chief Technology Officer Clint Kennedy said 90 percent of systems are back up and running and the disaster recovery process is underway with the help of local police. Schools Superintendent Susan Austin confirmed the internet had been restored to 90% and the incident was under investigation.
title: Groton schools’ internet outage from ‘cyber-attack’ under investigation

summary: The IT network of the Kelheim district authorities in Germany was the victim of a cyberattack, leading to the hacking of the central server. As a result, online services, including online applications, email and telephone services, are unavailable to the district office and almost all affected cities and municipalities. The district office disconnected internet connections to allow systems to be inspected and disinfected, with a resumption scheduled for the following Monday.
title: Kelheim authorities network offline until Monday after cyber attack | charivari

summary: The "Klikk & hent"-tjenesten (click and collect service) of duty-free shops at Norway's largest airports was out of service for several weeks following a hacker attack. No personal or customer data was disclosed, and Travel Retail Norway said its systems would be restored within the week, moving to cloud-based infrastructure rather than private servers. Although the identity of the attackers was known to the company, it was not publicly revealed on the advice of cybersecurity experts, and no ransom was paid, although the attack did incur costs.
title: Ransom demanded after cyber attack

summary: Willis Lease Finance Corporation, an aircraft parts leasing company, reported to the SEC that it was the victim of a cyberattack detected on January 31, the unauthorized activity of which was completely contained on February 2, without that the company cannot yet determine the extent of the affected data. Ransomware group Black Basta claimed responsibility for the attack, claiming to have stolen more than 900 GB of sensitive data and threatening to release it publicly. Black Basta has been active since April 2022 and has been linked to over 300 infections, with ransom demands estimated at around $100 million as of November 2023.
title: Willis Lease Finance Corp Discloses Cyberattack - SecurityWeek

summary: Lower Austria's WIFI has been the victim of a cyberattack. No ransom demands have been made following the attack. Messages on X (formerly Twitter) indicate that the Russian-speaking hacker group Lockbit has claimed responsibility for the attack on the Darknet.
title: Hacker attack on WIFI Lower Austria - Lower Austria | Heute.at

summary: Lurie Children's Hospital in Chicago is investigating a cybersecurity incident that has caused their computer, internet and phone networks to go down for the second day in a row. The hospital is working with experts and law enforcement to resolve the issue and has taken its network systems offline in response to the incident. The outage has forced the cancellation of some elective surgeries and procedures, and while emergency departments have not been affected, staff have had to revert to manual work methods, such as using paper charts.
title: Lurie Children's outage: Chicago hospital investigating 'cyber security matter' as internet, phone outage continues for 2nd day - ABC7 Chicago

summary: Cuba postponed a highly unpopular increase in gasoline prices scheduled for February 1 due to a cyberattack, according to Deputy Economy Minister Mildrey Granadillo, who announced that the computer attack was due to a virus coming from abroad.
title: Cuba delays Feb. 1 fuel price hike, cites cyberattack By Reuters

summary: Viamedis, an organization managing third-party payment for complementary health insurance, suffered a cyberattack, leading to the disconnection of its platform and the establishment of an investigation with notification to the competent authorities (CNIL, ANSSI). The compromised personal data includes marital status, date of birth and social security number, but no banking information, medical data or contact information was affected. Customers are invited to remain vigilant in the face of possible unusual messages or calls and to report any suspicious activity to the Customer Relations department or via an online form.
title: Safety info: important information

summary: The Caritas-Klinik Dominikus in Berlin was the victim of a cyberattack. Details of the affected systems and the extent of the attack are currently unknown, and analysis is underway. After discovering the attack, the IT department, together with experts from an external security company, immediately took significant measures to quickly stop the spread of the attack.
title: Cyber ​​attack on Caritas Clinic Dominikus in Berlin - kma Online

summary: The City of Jacksonville Beach, Florida, has confirmed that it was the victim of a cyberattack that resulted in the closure of City Hall and the disruption of many city services. City officials said they are working to restore systems and services and that an investigation is underway, without providing further details at this time. This incident joins other cyberattacks on Florida cities, such as Lake City and Riviera Beach, that took place five years ago and led to six-figure ransom payments.
title: Jacksonville Beach admits city tech services have been hacked

summary: Therme Laa was attacked, resulting in the theft of its employees' data, but managed to resume normal operations the next day without receiving a ransom demand.
title: Cyber ​​attacks on Korneuburg and Therme Laa - noe.ORF.at

summary: Balmain's website has been down for 10 days following a major cyberattack, but the systems of its associated companies AMAL, Wave Money and MitchCap, which offer various financial services, were not affected. There is no indication that the systems of D'Albora, in which Balmain is a lead investor, were compromised. Balmain is working with external experts to resolve the issue and hopes to restore its systems, including those it hosts for Metro, as soon as possible.
title: Cyberattack: Balmain’s website down 10 days after major hack

summary: The computer server of the Faculty of Education of the University of Hong Kong suffered a cyberattack on the 30th of last month, leading to the possible leak of internal documents, including classroom reservation records, internal guidelines, system administration documents, as well as meeting minutes and files since 2012. Potentially affected personal data includes that of approximately 400 visiting researchers, the learning progress of some 3,000 students, and application summaries of closely of 4,000 graduate research students, but there is no evidence that sensitive information like
title: The computer server of the Faculty of Education of the University of Hong Kong was attacked by a cyberattack or agenda documents and records were leaked
url: https://www.bastillepost.com/hongkong/article/13821470-港大教育學院電腦伺服器遭網絡攻擊或洩議程文件

summary: Digitel, the second largest mobile operator in Venezuela, has confirmed that it suffered a cyberattack but assures that its users' data has not been compromised thanks to the activation of their security mechanisms. Following the attack, the company had to preventively block its servers, which prevented subscribers from carrying out credit top-ups or accessing customer services. However, the organization Venezuela Sin Filtro is demanding more transparency from Digitel regarding the details of the attack and the security of customer data.
title: Digitel confirms cyber attack but says user data was not compromised

summary: Cameroon’s main electricity operator, Eneo, has been the victim of a cyberattack that has severely disrupted its IT system since January 29, 2024. In response, the company has disabled some applications to secure the system and is working on resolving the issue, asking customers to retry their transactions in the event of slowness or unavailability. Customers have encountered difficulties recharging their prepaid meters via the Mtn and Orange mobile money platforms, but Eneo has only reported disruptions to its IT network.
title: Cameroon: Major electricity operator targeted by cyberattack - KOACI

summary: EPS Salud Total in Colombia was the victim of a cyberattack which affected its technological platform and its 4.6 million members. The Superintendencia Nacional de Salud (SuperSalud) intervenes by verifying the contingency and continuity plan put in place by the EPS to face the attack and maintain the service. SuperSalud also asked EPS to keep its affiliates informed of events and steps taken to resolve issues arising from the attack.
title: Cyber ​​attack on EPS Salud Total affects 4.6 million members, SuperSalud intervenes | Red+ News Colombia

summary: Western Union's money transfer services to Cuba have been suspended since January 28, following a "cybersecurity incident" announced by the Cuban government. This is affecting families in Miami who are no longer able to send money to their loved ones on the island. Although the Cuban government has linked the incident to a cyberattack, Western Union did not disclose the service disruption until contacted. The company is working to restore services with its processing partner, Orbit SA, but details on when services will resume remain unclear.
title: Western Union money transfer service to Cuba is suspended | Miami Herald

summary: The IT systems of district clinics in Middle Franconia were targeted by a cyberattack, resulting in the encryption of data, including personal and internal company documents. In response, all systems were disconnected for security reasons and authorities, including the police, public prosecutor's office and relevant ministries, were informed. Despite these disruptions, patient care remains assured, although communication is currently limited mainly to telephone calls.
title: Hacker attack on district hospitals in Middle Franconia | BR24

summary: The Volkshochschule (Vhs) in Vaterstetten, Germany, was the victim of a cyberattack which affected almost its entire server structure, rendering it partially inoperable. Those responsible took IT security measures with the help of external experts and reported the incident to the competent authorities, including the Bavarian Data Protection Office and the police. Although Vhs is operating in emergency mode, it remains accessible by telephone, in person and its website is operational for online registrations, while current classes continue.
title: “Partially unworkable”: Cyber ​​attack on the Vhs Vaterstetten

summary: The Freehold Township School District announced the closure of all of its schools and offices on Monday following a cyberattack, according to NJ12. Management has informed families and staff that they are experiencing technical issues as a result of this cybersecurity incident. Officials are working with external IT experts to resolve the problem, but details of the attack and the affected systems have not been disclosed.
title: Freehold Schools Shuttered by Cyberattack - Lakewood News Network

summary: The IT system of the regional health of Basilicata in Italy suffered a cyberattack on 28 January, causing disruptions. The ASP (Azienda sanitaria locale) informed the relevant authorities and set up a crisis unit to manage the situation. Difficulties in health services could persist on 29 January, and an apology was offered to users by the Director General of the ASP Basilicata, Antonello Maraldo, while assuring that efforts are underway to resolve the problem.
title: Healthcare Basilicata, "hacker attack" on the regional IT system - Basilicata24

summary: The National Cancer Institute (INCA) in Brazil suffered a cyberattack which disrupted the radiology service and appointment scheduling since Saturday 27. The institute activated its internal security program and interrupted its technological services to protect data and avoid further damage. Scheduled consultations continue with manual recordings, but the booking of new appointments is suspended.
title: INCA is the target of cyber attack | News | baguette

summary: A cyberattack disrupted court systems in Georgia's Fulton County, where former President Donald Trump is involved in a criminal case related to allegations of interference in the 2020 election results. Systems affected by the attack include courts, taxes, guns and marriage licenses. Officials, including Robb Pitts, chairman of the board of county commissioners, are working to restore normal operations.
title: Cyberattack Hits Georgia County Where Trump Is Charged - Bloomberg

summary: On the morning of January 26, 2024, the IT systems of Kunath, a medium-sized company specializing in the manufacture of professional clothing and based in Bretnig-Hauswalde, were paralyzed by a cyberattack. The company, which employs 57 people and mainly produces clothing for retirement homes, had to face a critical situation where "it almost came to an end for everything to die out", according to Christian Hartmann, member of management. As a result of the attack, transactions within the company had to be processed manually.
title: Kamenz: How a company from the Bautzen district fell victim to a cyber attack | Sächsische.de

summary: The Santa Cruz do Sul town hall was the victim of a cyberattack which affected its computer network, leading to the interruption of telephone and internet services in several of its departments. As a result, the town hall website is offline and registrations for the Secretary of Education selection process have been extended. No data breaches have been reported and the town hall has taken steps to restore services as quickly as possible.
title: Santa Cruz City Hall is target of cyber attack

victim: Group Health Cooperative of South Central Wisconsin
summary: Group Health Cooperative of South Central Wisconsin alerted its members of a “potential cybersecurity event,” which forced the health insurer to shut down some of its online and IT services. Although the event was quickly identified, GHC secured all of its IT systems with internet access as a precaution, affecting some systems and services during the investigation, including the telephone system and patient access to online medical records via MyChart.
title: GHC reports possible cyber attack affecting services

summary: The Concello (municipality) is working to restore its main services after suffering a cyberattack on Wednesday January 24, which paralyzed administrative activity for the following days. The authorities are collaborating with the Agency for Technological Modernization of Galicia (AMTEGA) and the Provincial Delegation of A Coruña to investigate the attack, and the facts have been reported to the Civil Guard as well as to the national cybersecurity and security bodies. Data protection. The Concello de Teo reassures citizens and encourages them to report any suspicious communications emanating from the municipality.
title: The Council is working to recover its main services after suffering a cyber attack last Thursday

summary: Last week, the Linn County Sheriff's Office was the target of a cyberattack, but no data breaches were reported and no ransom messages were received. Sheriff Michelle Duncan said the attack was quickly isolated and increased security measures were put in place, although few details were released. In response, the City of Albany took additional precautions, including cutting off communications with Sheriff's Office servers, which significantly impacted the Albany Fire and Police departments.
title: Cyberattack reported on Linn County Sheriff's Office

summary: Global Affairs Canada's systems were compromised in a data breach, with preliminary indications of "unauthorized access to personal information of users, including employees." Steps are being taken to protect sensitive information and network security, particularly following the discovery of malicious activity leading to an intentional shutdown of remote access to GAC's network on January 24, 2024. An investigation is underway and Global Affairs Canada is working with IT partners to restore full connectivity and has informed those affected by the breach.
title: Global Affairs Canada systems compromised in data breach - National | Globalnews.ca

summary: Misbourne School was forced to close due to a cyber attack which compromised some of its IT systems, affecting infrastructure and operations. The establishment will be partially closed on Friday January 26, with distance learning for some levels, and hopes to partially reopen for other levels on Friday January 27. The school management is working with the relevant authorities to restore systems, will report the incident to the ICO in accordance with the GDPR, and remains in contact with various stakeholders, including the Department for Education and the National Center for Cybersecurity.
title: Misbourne School remains closed due to cyber attack | Bucks Free Press

victim: Centre de coordination des services de communication en santé (CCSC)
summary: A cyberattack, with ransomware, paralyzed the computer systems of the Health Communication Services Coordination Center (CCSC), affecting ambulance services in several regions, including the Capitale-Nationale, Saguenay-Lac-St-Jean and the North -of Quebec. Emergency calls are now redirected to the Chaudière-Appalaches Emergency Call Center (CAUCA), and although officials say that services to the population are not affected, paramedics on the ground are having difficulty responding. locate the calls, which created a "total panic" situation.
title: Hackers attack ambulance services

summary: The Washington County government in Pennsylvania was targeted by hackers, leading to a preemptive shutdown of their servers following a security warning received from Homeland Security officials. Although the county's 911 system remained operational, unlike Bucks County's also affected, routine operations at the Washington courthouse are being done manually, pending an official update on the exact nature of the incident.
title: Washington County government targeted by hackers - WPXI

summary: Richmond Fellowship Scotland, a Scottish charity, has been the target of a major cyberattack which has resulted in its digital systems being taken down. Police Scotland are investigating the incident after staff discovered systems had been compromised, but it is not yet clear whether any personal data was stolen. The organisation, which is the largest provider of social services in Scotland, employs more than 3,300 people and runs around 190 services across the country.
title: Scots charity targeted by cyber hackers with 'all of its systems down' | The Scottish Sun

summary: The Kansas City Area Transportation Authority (KCATA) was the victim of a cyberattack Tuesday morning, knocking several of its systems offline, including regional RideKC call centers and landlines. Agency Chairman Reginald Townsend said relevant authorities, including the FBI, were immediately contacted to investigate, and he expressed confidence in the agency's data storage policies to secure systems and the data.
title: Kansas City Area Transportation Authority hit with cyberattack Tuesday

summary: The Department of Sarthe was the target of a cyberattack revealed by Dominique Le Mèner, president of the Departmental Council, which led to a leak of passwords on the darknet. The Department's services reacted quickly to counter the attack and the Department's website is temporarily blocked, with a resolution expected for the day of the budgetary orientation debate. This incident is part of a series of similar attacks that have recently affected other departmental councils such as Loiret and Seine-Maritime.
title: The Department of Sarthe targeted by a cyberattack | News Le Mans

summary: Grace Lutheran Foundation, operating as Grace Lutheran Communities in Wisconsin, was the victim of a cyberattack by the BlackCat group, which acquired 70GB of sensitive personal data from employees and residents, including social security and health insurance information. Although Grace Lutheran attempted to negotiate with the attackers, the talks failed and the organization stopped responding, leading BlackCat to publish the data on the dark web.
title: Grace Lutheran Communities attacked by BlackCat; employee and resident data acquired

summary: ICN Business School, a management school based in Nancy, was the victim of a cyber intrusion with a ransom demand, involving the threat of data distribution on the darknet. The attack was claimed on franchise showcase site LockBit 3.0 on January 24.
title: The Nancy school ICN Business School victim of a cyber attack

summary: The Volkshochschule (VHS) in Minden-Bad Oeynhausen, Germany, was the victim of a cyberattack on Monday afternoon, January 22. The institution filed a complaint following this incident. The police have started their investigations to shed light on this computer attack.
title: Cyber ​​attack on VHS: Police have launched investigation

summary: Financial technology company EquiLend, owner of the NGT platform that executes securities trades worth $2.4 trillion per month, confirmed unauthorized access to its systems on January 22, disrupting some of its services . EquiLend is working with external cybersecurity firms to investigate and restore services, and warns that restoration could take several days. This incident comes shortly after the announcement of the acquisition of a majority stake in EquiLend by the private equity firm Welsh, Carson, Anderson & Stowe, planned for the second quarter of 2024.
title: $2.4 trillion securities platform owner hacked. EquiLend admits "unauthorised access"

summary: Bucks County's computer-aided dispatch (CAD) system was knocked out of service Sunday following a suspected cyberattack, affecting local emergency services who had to revert to using pen and paper. Local authorities confirmed the cybersecurity incident without giving a time frame for system restoration, while keeping the 9-1-1 emergency call center operational to continue receiving calls and dispatching teams to the area. ground. The attack also disabled the county's access to state and federal court databases, although some agencies could access them independently.
title: UPDATE: Bucks County Computer-Aided Dispatch System Crippled By Cyberattack - New Hope Free Press

summary: The Caravan and Motorhome Club (CAMC) in the UK has been dealing with a major IT outage for five days, suspected to be due to a cyber attack, leading to widespread disruption to its digital services and affecting bookings for its members. The company reported the incident to the UK's Information Commissioner's Office (ICO), implying a possible data security breach, although it says there is no proof that member data has been compromised. Despite member complaints about lack of direct communication, CAMC is working with external teams to restore its systems
title: Major IT outage denies happy campers their caravan holidays • The Register

victim: Canterbury Council (le conseil municipal de Canterbury)
summary: Canterbury City Council is investigating a cybersecurity incident with the assistance of the National Cyber ​​Security Centre. Although the email system and website remained accessible, some site functionality may be affected, and there is no indication that customer data has been compromised. The council apologizes for the inconvenience caused and clarifies that the contractor Civica does not provide IT services to the council but manages other services such as revenue, benefits, debt recovery and customer service.
title: Cyber incident under investigation - Canterbury Newsroom

summary: The Japan Foods Holding Ltd. group was the victim of a ransomware attack, with unauthorized access to its servers, detected on January 19, 2024. Despite the impact on stored data, the group took immediate measures to identify, contain and restore the affected servers , also reporting the incident to the Singapore Police Force and the Personal Data Protection Commission. According to a preliminary investigation, there is no evidence of a data leak or compromise of sensitive personal information, and the group has activated its business continuity plan, ensuring that no significant disruption has occurred until 'now.
title: Cybersecurity Incident

summary: Clackamas Community College's computer network was hacked on Friday, January 19, resulting in the disabling of its website, email system and online learning platforms. Law enforcement and the property's IT team are working to investigate and resolve the issue, and although two servers were targeted, it is not yet known whether any personal data was compromised. Classes have been canceled for January 22 and 23 to allow IT services to make necessary repairs.
title: Clackamas Community College computer network hacked - The Clackamas Print

summary: One of Tietoevry's data centers in Sweden was partially affected by a ransomware attack on the night of January 19-20, affecting services for some customers. Tietoevry has isolated the affected platform, mobilized a team of experts to resolve the problem and is in constant dialogue with impacted customers. The incident is being thoroughly investigated by internal and external specialists and has been reported to the police, while the company works to restore services following a proven methodology.
title: UPDATE: Ransomware attack in Swedish data center

summary: The town of Greater Napanee, Ontario, was the target of a cyberattack, city officials revealed in a news release Friday. After learning of the incident on Thursday, the city quickly responded by shutting down access to its systems to limit the impact and preserve their integrity, while calling in experts to investigate and informing law enforcement. 'order. The details and extent of the impact of the attack remain unknown, but the city promises to release additional information as it becomes available and to contact those affected directly after the investigation.
title: Town of Greater Napanee targeted by hackers, impact as yet unknown - Kingston | Globalnews.ca

summary: SEIU Local 1000, one of California’s largest unions, has confirmed it is the victim of a cyberattack after the LockBit ransomware group claimed to have stolen 308 gigabytes of sensitive data from the organization. The union is working with outside experts to secure its network and restore operations while assisting law enforcement with their investigation. In response to the incident, SEIU Local 1000 plans to offer credit monitoring and identity theft protection services to potential victims.
title: California union confirms ransomware attack following LockBit claims

summary: The company Ecosystem was the victim of a cyberattack by Akira ransomware on January 17, leading to the impact of internal servers and the temporary suspension of its online services. Despite the gradual reopening of services and restoration of email, Ecosystem revealed that the attack exploited a zero-day flaw in one of their Cisco ASA VPNs. The Akira group, linked to the Conti cybercriminal group, has been known to exploit this vulnerability since August 2023.
title: Ecosystem claims to be victim of Akira ransomware | LeMagIT

summary: Energy management and automation giant Schneider Electric was the victim of a Cactus ransomware attack, leading to the theft of corporate data within its Sustainability Business division on January 17. The attack disrupted the company's Resource Advisor cloud platform, which is still experiencing downtime. Schneider Electric confirmed the attack and is working to restore affected systems, while specifying that the incident was limited to this division and did not impact other parts of the company.
title: Energy giant Schneider Electric hit by Cactus ransomware attack

summary: Veolia North America's Municipal Water division was hit by a ransomware incident, affecting certain software applications and systems, leading to delays in customers' online payment systems. Veolia has taken defensive measures, such as taking targeted systems offline, and is working with law enforcement and third parties to investigate the incident, which appears not to have affected water treatment operations or Wastewater. The company has identified a limited number of individuals whose personal information was potentially impacted and is partnering with a cyber forensics firm to prevent future incidents.
title: Veolia Responds to Cyber Incident | Veolia Water

summary: The Virgin Islands Lottery has postponed its Jan. 18 drawing due to a technology breach that caused multiple failures in its computer system. All retail and administrative services have been suspended until further notice, and an IT team and cybersecurity experts are working around the clock to resolve the issue. This incident is the latest in a series of cyberattacks suffered by Virgin Islands government agencies in recent years, including email scams and ransomware attacks.
title: Lottery postpones drawing due to "collapse" of computer system | News | virginislandsdailynews.com

summary: The räddningstjänsten (emergency service) in the Jämtland region of Sweden was the target of a cyberattack overnight from Wednesday to Thursday, affecting their alert system. Staff were alerted to the incident after midnight through warnings from their computer system. Currently, the service uses a backup system for alerts and has several other backup systems in case of need, according to Niclas von Essen, chief technology officer.
title: Cyber ​​attack against the emergency services

summary: The radio station Donau 3 FM in Ulm was the victim of a cyberattack on Wednesday afternoon, resulting in the paralysis of its computers. Faced with this situation, the team had to improvise by using an external mixing desk and personal CD players to continue broadcasting their program, practicing "radio as before". Despite the attack and an unconfirmed ransom demand by police, station staff remain in contact with listeners via WhatsApp to receive music requests and keep the station active.
title: Cyber ​​attack in Ulm: Radio like before - Computers at Donau 3 FM paralyzed | Südwest Presse Online

summary: Kansas State University experienced a disruption to some of its network systems, including VPN, K-State Today emails, and videos on Canvas or Mediasite, following a cybersecurity incident that occurred around Tuesday 16 January. Affected systems have been taken offline for investigation, with the assistance of third-party computer forensic experts, and measures are being taken to maintain continuity of academic and administrative activities. The university has communicated the importance of following cybersecurity best practices and will continue to update the university community as it manages the incident.
title: Recent events update

summary: Three Kent councils, Canterbury City Council, Thanet District Council and Dover District Council, have suffered service disruptions following a cyber incident believed to be an organized hacking attack. Local authorities are working with experts from the National Cyber ​​Security Center to investigate the breach, and it is not yet confirmed whether any personal data was compromised. Services affected include planning departments, online forms and maps on council websites, and preventative measures are being taken during the investigation.
title: Canterbury City Council, Thanet District Council and Dover District Council suffers issues after ‘cyber incident’

victim: Foxsemicon Integrated Technology Inc (京鼎精密)
summary: On January 15, Foxconn's semiconductor equipment subsidiary Foxsemicon Integrated Technology Inc was the victim of a cyberattack and hackers demanded a $1 million ransom. The hackers threatened to leak customer data and cause employees to lose their jobs if the ransom was not paid. Foxsemicon Integrated Technology Inc responded that the attack did not have a major impact on the company's operations and that defense and recovery measures were put in place in collaboration with external security experts.
title: Breaking news! Major semiconductor company blackmailed by hackers! - EE Times

summary: The Douglas County Library was the victim of a cyberattack by an international criminal group called “Playcrypt,” believed to have ties to Russia. The library’s system was paralyzed, affecting the online catalog and lending services, but no personal user information was compromised. The library, which recently received an excellent rating in a cybersecurity audit, is working with a specialized firm and its cybersecurity insurance to recover from the attack and has already restored about half of its online services.
title: Douglas County Libraries hacked by overseas criminal group - CBS Colorado

summary: Sambr'Habitat, a public housing company located in Sambreville and Jemeppe-sur-Sambre, is forced to operate slowly following a cyberattack. The details of the attack and its exact impact on the company's operations are not fully disclosed in the accessible text.
title: Computer attack: Sambr’Habitat, the public housing company of Sambreville and Jemeppe-sur-Sambre, must operate slowly

summary: The Calvia town hall in Majorca was the victim of a cyberattack detected early on Saturday morning, leading to the formation of a crisis committee including IT specialists, department heads and municipal councilors. A forensic analysis of the attack is underway by the IT department and external experts, and a report will be sent to the Telematic Services Unit of the Guardia Civil.
title: Mallorca crime: Calvia town hall suffers a cyberattack

summary: Lush is investigating a cyber attack and has taken immediate action to secure its systems. Based in Poole, the company works with external IT forensic specialists to carry out a thorough investigation. Lush has also informed the competent authorities and recalls that in 2011, its website had already been the target of hackers.
title: Lush investigating cyber security attack | Bournemouth Echo

summary: RE&S Holdings, a Japanese company operating in the restaurant sector, was the victim of a ransomware attack, with unauthorized access to its servers. Despite the impact on stored data, the company activated its business continuity plan, saying no significant impact on its operations has been seen so far, and it reported the incident to the Commission protection of personal data.
title: RE&S latest Singapore-listed company to be hit by spate of ransomware attacks

summary: Long Island Plastic Surgical Group (LIPSG), a plastic surgery group in New York, was the victim of a joint ransomware attack by two cybercriminal groups, AlphV and Radar, who encrypted files and exfiltrated approximately 700 GB data, including internal documents, employee information and patient records. Despite LIPSG paying $500,000 for a decryption key, negotiations with Radar to delete the data have failed and the group is threatening to harm the company by publishing the data. DataBreaches.net attempted to contact LIPSG without success and also informed patients affected by the
title: Another plastic surgery group has fallen victim to a ransomware attack - DataBreaches.net

summary: Hyundai Motor Europe has been the victim of a Black Basta ransomware attack, in which cybercriminals claim to have stolen three terabytes of corporate data. Although Hyundai initially said it was facing IT issues, the company later confirmed the attack after additional information about the data theft was shared with them. Black Basta, believed to be an offshoot of the Conti ransomware operation, is known for its double extortion attacks and has reportedly received more than $100 million in ransom payments since its launch in April 2022.
title: Hyundai Motor Europe hit by Black Basta ransomware attack

summary: The National Bank of Angola suffered a cyberattack on January 6, but said it mitigated the incident without significant impacts on its infrastructure and data. No hacker group has claimed responsibility for the attack, although an offer of access to the bank's systems was previously reported on a cybercrime forum. Several other banks in the country were mentioned in the leak site of a now-dormant ransomware group, and cyberattacks have been reported by other state banks in recent years.
title: National Bank of Angola says it mitigated cyberattack

summary: US mortgage company loanDepot was hit by a cyberattack that took its IT systems and payment portal offline, preventing online loan payments. The company is working with law enforcement and cybercrime experts to investigate the incident. Although the exact nature of the attack has not been disclosed, it is possible that it was a ransomware attack, and customers are being warned of the possibility of phishing and identity theft following the compromise of sensitive data in a previous breach in August 2022.
title: Mortgage firm loanDepot cyberattack impacts IT systems, payment portal

summary: The Handwerkskammer (Chamber of Trades) of Koblenz in Germany was the victim of a cyberattack, following which it disconnected all its systems as a security measure, making its website and management software inaccessible. According to director Ralf Hellrich, no personal or company data was compromised. Other trade chambers in the region, managed by the same IT service provider, ODAV AG, were also affected by this targeted and professional attack aimed at encrypting data to demand a ransom.
title: Cyber ​​attack on Koblenz Chamber of Crafts - SWR Aktuell

summary: The Toronto Zoo has been hit by a ransomware attack, following a similar attack on the city’s public library. The impact on guests, members and donors is being investigated, but no credit card information is currently being stored. Despite the attack, animal welfare, care and support systems were not impacted and the zoo continues to operate as normal.
title: Toronto Zoo hit by ransomware attack

summary: Paraguay is on alert following a suspected ransomware cyberattack that hit the corporate division of a telecommunications company, affecting more than 300 local businesses. The General Directorate of Information and Communication Technologies of the Military Forces has issued an official alert bulletin concerning the possible consequences of the ransomware infection. Local media reported that the attack impacted customers in Tigo's corporate domain since Thursday, and Tigo Business admitted to having suffered a "security incident" in its infrastructure.
title: Paraguay on alert after cyber attack; at least 300 companies affected - Ruetir

summary: The city of Beckley was targeted by a cyberattack that affected its computer network, according to a city news release. Authorities are investigating the origin of the attack, determining its full scope and impact, and verifying whether any data was compromised. The article does not specify the exact date of the attack, only mentioning that it took place recently, and indicates that the story is still developing.
title: City of Beckley responds to cyber attack | Don't Miss This | cleburnetimesreview.com

summary: The Lancaster County Sheriff's Office was the victim of a cyberattack, publicly revealed at a Lancaster Board of Supervisors meeting in late March. The attack, which occurred in early 2024, was identified as ransomware, but security measures in place limited the attackers' access to the information. An insurance company hired a computer forensics firm to investigate, and the Virginia State Police also participated in the investigations.
title: Lancaster Sheriff’s Office reveals its cyber attack | News | newsontheneck.com

summary: Import pricing agency Itac was targeted by a ransomware attack, leading to immediate measures being taken such as shutting down affected servers, upgrading firewalls and antiviruses, and launching a thorough investigation. Itac acknowledged that personal information regarding its employees, service providers, importers, exporters and other stakeholders, stored on its servers, could have been compromised and potentially extracted by the hackers.
title: Import tariff body Itac was targeted in ransomware attack

summary: The town of Saint-Philippe was targeted by a ransomware attack on January 1, leading to the shutdown of several digital services, including the civil registry and the electoral office. A complaint was filed following this cyberattack and the town hall is working with a company specializing in cybersecurity to manage the situation and restore the affected services. Despite the attack, the town hall's telephone and physical reception continues to operate at normal hours.
title: The town of Saint-Philippe was the victim of a cyber attack on January 1: a complaint filed - LINFO.re

summary: The integrated health information system of the Bosnian Serb entity, Republika Srpska, is partially back online after a ransomware cyberattack that knocked it out of service for 17 days, but only in six health centers and without the laboratory services. Citizen data would have been preserved, but some hacked information would already be for sale on the dark web. Despite an investment of nearly 13 million euros in the system, it is not yet fully functioning nor has it integrated all health institutions more than a year after its implementation.
title: Bosnian Serb Entity Healthcare System Partly Back Online After Cyber Attack | Balkan Insight

summary: Memorial University has announced that a cybersecurity incident is affecting the Grenfell campus in Corner Brook, and as a result, information technology (IT) services at the Marine Institute have been temporarily suspended. Security protocols have been put in place to isolate affected systems and an investigation is underway with the assistance of cybersecurity experts, although the extent and cause of the incident remain unknown. The university advised that it will directly notify individuals whose information may be compromised and that it is working to mitigate impacts to academic, research and administrative activities.
title: Cybersecurity issue affecting Grenfell Campus of Memorial University | CBC News

summary: Fouesnant town hall was the target of a significant cyberattack which paralyzed all its services, with the exception of the service for issuing passports and national identity cards, which remains operational thanks to a line secured by the State. The town hall's telephone and physical reception continues to operate during normal hours, and citizens are asked to postpone non-urgent requests.
title: Fouesnant town hall victim of cyberattack | The Telegram

summary: On January 2, IPS Securex announced that the group's servers had recently been hacked. An unknown party allegedly had unauthorized access to its servers, rendering its network inaccessible. The group took immediate action with external experts to identify, contain and address the incident on its affected servers.
title: IPS Securex’s servers hacked; no evidence of data exfiltration from cyberattack

summary: Xerox has confirmed that one of its subsidiaries, XBS, was the victim of a cyberattack involving the potential theft of personal information, following claims of an attack by the INC Ransomware group. The company said the incident did not affect its corporate systems or operations, but limited personal information in the XBS environment may have been compromised. Xerox had already been targeted by ransomware attacks in the past, notably by the Maze group in 2020 and had been mentioned in communications from the Conti group in 2022.
title: After ransomware claims, Xerox says subsidiary hit with cyberattack

summary: Healthcare services company WebTPA suffered a data breach that affected approximately 2.5 million people, exposing personal information such as names, contact details, Social Security numbers and insurance information. The incident was detected on December 28, 2023 and investigations revealed that the data was compromised between April 18 and 23, 2023. WebTPA is offering two years of free identity monitoring services to affected individuals and has implemented additional security measures to improve the security of its network.
title: Healthcare firm WebTPA data breach impacted 2.5M individuals

summary: TiAuto Investments (TiAuto, Tiger Wheel & Tire and other companies), reported to suppliers that it suffered a ransomware cyberattack on December 28, 2023. The group said it did not give in to the extortion demands and is in the process of gradually bringing back its online systems. TiAuto assured that it never plans to pay ransoms or negotiate with criminals, and that any individual who could be affected was informed, although it is unknown whether there was data theft during the intrusion.
title: Tiger Wheel & Tyre parent hit with ransomware attack

summary: Museum software solutions provider Gallery Systems was hit by a ransomware attack on December 28, causing its systems to be taken offline to prevent the spread of malicious encryption. As a result, the eMuseum online public viewing platforms, used by more than 800 museums, including renowned institutions like MoMA and the Met, are currently unavailable. Gallery Systems has notified authorities and is conducting an internal investigation, while working to restore data from the latest available backup.
title: Online museum collections down after cyberattack on service provider

summary: DENHAM the Jeanmaker, a renowned denim brand based in Amsterdam, was the victim of a cyberattack discovered on December 27, 2023, attributed to the Akira ransomware group, although the company has not confirmed this involvement. The attack did not have a significant impact on the brand's operations thanks to a rapid response and the intervention of a specialist cybersecurity firm, and no personal consumer data was compromised. DENHAM has taken additional security measures and informed the Dutch Data Protection Authority as a precautionary measure, while being committed to protecting the confidentiality of its customers' data, parten
title: TCE Exclusive: DENHAM Cyberattack - What You Need To Know

summary: Auto giant Eagers suspended trading in its shares on Wednesday and called in experts to assess the fallout from a recent cyberattack. It called for the suspension to last until at least Friday after identifying a "cyber incident" which chief executive Keith Thornton said was disrupting the company's operations.
title: Listed car retailer Eagers Automotive assesses damage from cyberattack | The West Australian

summary: MedQ, Inc., a provider of administrative services to HIPAA covered entities, was the victim of a ransomware attack around December 26, 2023. Some of the servers used by the MedQ platform and hosted on a third-party platform were encrypted during the attack. The forensic investigation confirmed that files were copied from the servers between December 20 and 26, 2023, before the files were encrypted.
title: Cogdell Memorial Hospital Cyberattack Affects 87,000 Patients

summary: The Fundação Caixa Beneficente dos Servidores (Funcabes), affiliated with the University of Taubaté (Unitau), was the victim of a cyberattack during the end-of-year period. The hackers managed to gain access to a computer and compromise documents and spreadsheets, but were unable to penetrate the institution's systems or databases. A cryptocurrency ransom document was discovered on the infected computer, and Unitau reported the incident to the police for investigation.
title: Funcabes is the target of cyber attack

victim: Syndicat Général des Vignerons de la Champagne
summary: On December 26, the SGV reported an exceptional event to justify the unavailability of its services between Christmas and the New Year. Consistent sources report a cyberattack. The Onyphe data highlights an Exchange server still affected, in mid-December, by the so-called ProxyNotShell vulnerabilities.
title: Following an exceptional event, all SGV Champagne services will be unavailable between Christmas and New Year's Day.

victim: National Insurance Board of Trinidad and Tobago (NIBTT)
summary: The offices of the National Insurance Board of Trinidad and Tobago (NIBTT) will be closed from Wednesday to Friday (December 27-29) following a ransomware attack on Tuesday. NIBTT is evaluating its systems to protect the integrity of its data and technology hardware, while working with external technology partners to quickly resolve the issue. The incident was reported to the Trinidad and Tobago Cybersecurity Incident Response Team under the Ministry of National Security, with whom NIBTT is working to find a solution.
title: Ransomware attack forces closure of NIB offices | Loop Trinidad & Tobago

summary: The Cullman County Courthouse in Alabama was the victim of a ransomware attack over the weekend, disrupting online payments, including for property taxes. County Revenue Commissioner Barry Willingham discovered the attack after being informed via a Facebook message that a resident was unable to make a payment online. No specific date for restoring the system has been announced, but the goal is to have it back in service by Thursday or Friday, and late payments will be accepted until January 5, with a possible extension until January 8.
title: Cullman County Courthouse victim of cyberattack

summary: Unidentified attackers compromised the IT systems of the Katholische Hospitalvereinigung Ostwestfalen (KHO) in Germany, by targeted data encryption in an attack likely carried out by LockBit 3.0 ransomware. In response, all systems were immediately shut down for security reasons and a crisis headquarters was put in place, although patient data remained accessible through backup systems. The Bundeskriminalamt (Federal Criminal Police Office) has been informed and IT security specialists are working to resolve the problem, while the hospital continues to operate with
title: East Westphalia-Lippe: Cyber ​​attack on hospitals

summary: The municipality of Härjedalen in Sweden was the victim of a serious cyberattack the day before Christmas, paralyzing its IT systems and preventing operations such as paying bills or receiving emails. The municipality's IT technicians, helped by external consultants, have been working tirelessly since the attack to resolve the problem.
title: The IT attack against Härjedalen municipality is an attempt at blackmail

summary: At the end of December, the National Research Institute for Agriculture, Food and the Environment (INRAE) was the victim of a major cyberattack. Although heavily impacted, INRAE ​​ensures that the situation is now under control, and the teams are actively working towards a return to normal, with significant mobilization and solidarity. The Inrae of Burgundy-Franche-Comté, focused on agroecology, food, taste, economy and sociology of territories, is affected by this attack.
title: Burgundy-Franche-Comté. Cyberattack against INRAE: “We were strongly impacted”

summary: A cyber attack prevented card payments at Coop stores in Värmland, Sweden, for much of Friday. Klas Olsson, Coop Värmland’s communications director, said the problem has been resolved and card payments are working again, but that the attack was apparently aimed at a form of economic extortion without any ransom demand being made. Coop Värmland is still experiencing problems with its ordering systems and plans to work on resolving them throughout the Christmas period.
title: Hacker attack against Coop - can't pay by card

summary: A ransomware cyberattack in late 2023 compromised the personal data of nearly 185,000 people, according to Cherry Street Services (also known as Cherry Health), a nonprofit health care organization in Michigan. The attack, which took place on December 21 and was discovered on December 24, allowed the attackers to access financial information such as credit card numbers and associated security codes or passwords.
title: Michigan healthcare organization says ransomware breached data of 185,000

summary: On February 20, 2024, the Egyptian Health Department (EHD) reported a data breach following a cyberattack in December 2023, where sensitive consumer information, such as names, phone numbers social security, driver's license numbers, government identifiers, financial and insurance information, were accessed by an unauthorized actor. EHD secured its systems and conducted an investigation with cybersecurity experts, confirming that confidential patient and employee information was affected.
title: Egyptian Health Department Reports Data Breach Following December 2023 Cyberattack | Console and Associates, P.C. - JDSupra

summary: A healthcare institution, Xonar, based in South Limburg, was the victim of a cyberattack in which data was stolen. Employees, customers and other contact persons of the healthcare organization are currently being informed, and although it is not yet clear which data was stolen, Xonar claims that it has not yet been published by the hackers, and the possibility of a ransom demand has not been confirmed.
title: Data stolen in cyber attack on youth care institution Xonar - 1Limburg

summary: Victoria’s court system has been hit by a ransomware attack, discovered on December 21, that potentially exposed sensitive court recordings, including witness testimony. Cybersecurity experts believe Russian hackers are behind the attack, using commercial ransomware called Qilin to encrypt and steal the data, threatening to release it unless a ransom is paid. Court Services Victoria has isolated and disabled the affected network to contain the attack and set up a contact centre for those affected, ensuring January’s hearings will go ahead as planned.
title: Cyber attack on Victoria's court system may have exposed recordings of sensitive cases - ABC News

summary: A cybersecurity incident on December 21 impacted some Ohio Lottery internal applications, resulting in the unavailability of mobile payment options and prize redemptions over $599 at Super Retailers. While the public gaming system remains fully operational, winning numbers for KENO, Lucky One and EZPLAY progressive jackpots are not viewable on the website or mobile app, but can be verified at any Ohio Lottery retailer. Prize claims can still be submitted by mail to the Ohio Lottery Central Office.
title: Ohio Lottery cyber incident on Christmas Eve compromises mobile cashing

summary: Last week, the University of Innsbruck was the target of a cyberattack in which around 23,000 student master data were illegally downloaded. The compromised sensitive information includes personal details such as name, date of birth, gender, residential address and university email address. The police were alerted, countermeasures were taken, and although there was no action required for affected students, they were advised to remain vigilant against phishing attempts and report any suspicious incident.
title: Cyber ​​attack on the University of Innsbruck | PULS 24

victim: Le département de l'Urbanisme et du Logement de Madhya Pradesh (Inde).
summary: A major cyberattack targeted e-Municipality software in India's Madhya Pradesh state, leading to shutdown of online services in 412 civic authorities, except Bhopal Municipality. The servers and other networks of the Town Planning and Housing department have been shut down as a precautionary measure, but according to principal secretary Neeraj Mandloi, the data is secure and no leaks have been detected. Emergency Response Teams and India Cyber ​​Police are investigating the incident, and efforts are underway to restore the portal under the guidance of MPSEDC and experts.
title: Cyber ​​attack in MP: Cyber ​​attack on e-Municipality software, online service stopped in 412 bodies GeoTv News | Geo Tv News

summary: Ubisoft, a French video game publisher, is investigating a possible security breach after screenshots of its internal tools and development software were leaked online. An unidentified threat actor claimed to have broken into Ubisoft's systems on December 20 and planned the exfiltration of approximately 900 GB of data, including access to SharePoint servers, Microsoft Teams, Confluence and the MongoDB Atlas panel of the company.
title: Ubisoft says it's investigating reports of a new security breach

summary: First American, a real estate company, suffered a cyberattack that caused some of its systems to be taken offline and real estate transactions to be delayed. This incident comes shortly after First American was ordered to pay $1 million as part of a cybersecurity violation settlement with the New York Department of Financial Services. This is the second major attack in the securities industry in less than a month, following a ransomware attack on Fidelity National Financial, and other companies like Mr.Cooper have also been targeted by cyberattacks recently.
title: First American is the latest cybersecurity attack victim - HousingWire

summary: Kitco.com, an online media platform specializing in precious metals and financial markets news, has been temporarily taken offline following a major cyberattack, the specific details of which have not been disclosed. Users were informed of the incident via a message on Kitco's website, which has also set up an alternative email address to contact them.
title: Cyberattack On Kitco: Platform Temporarily Offline

victim: Mental Health Center of North Central Alabama
summary: The North Alabama Mental Health Center has notified 1,000 individuals of unauthorized access to their protected health information. The breach was detected on December 19, 2023 and although the investigation is still ongoing, it was confirmed that there was unauthorized access to certain systems for a short period in December.
title: Cogdell Memorial Hospital Cyberattack Affects 87,000 Patients

victim: Sage Home Loans Corporation (anciennement Lenox Financial Mortgage Corporation)
summary: On February 2, 2024, Sage Home Loans Corporation, formerly Lenox Financial Mortgage Corporation, announced that it was the victim of a cyberattack that allowed an unauthorized party to access sensitive consumer information, such as names, phone numbers social security, addresses, driver's license numbers, financial and medical information. The company detected unusual activity on December 19, 2023, which turned out to be related to a ransomware attack, and began sending data breach notification letters to affected individuals on February 2, 2024. Sage Home Loans Corporation is a financial services company based
title: Sage Home Loans / Lenox Financial Announces Data Breach Affecting Consumers Sensitive Information | Console and Associates, P.C. - JDSupra

summary: Liberty Hospital has been dealing with a disruption to its computer system since Dec. 19, causing emergency room patients to be transferred to other hospitals, while those hospitalized overnight continue to receive care. The hospital is actively investigating the cause of the disruption, emphasizing patient safety as its primary concern. Speculation on social media suggests a ransomware attack, but the hospital did not confirm the nature of the IT problem or the extent of the data impact, indicating ongoing efforts to assess the situation and restore the data. systems.
title: Liberty Hospital continues to divert ER patients after IT disruption | News | mycouriertribune.com

summary: St Vincent's Health Australia, the country's largest not-for-profit healthcare and aged care provider, was the victim of a major cyberattack on December 19, 2023, resulting in unauthorized data extraction. In response, the organization took immediate action to contain the incident, bringing in external security experts and notifying state and federal governments and agencies, while maintaining its services to patients and the community. The incident, which is currently being investigated with the assistance of the Australian Cyber ​​Security Centre, highlights the growing threat of cyberattacks in Australia, as in
title: Major Cyberattack on St Vincent's Health Australia

summary: HCL Technologies, a major IT company, announced that it was the victim of a ransomware attack in an isolated cloud environment dedicated to one of its projects, without affecting its overall network. An investigation is underway to determine the cause of the incident and take the necessary corrective measures. This comes as the company recently crossed a market capitalization of Rs 4 trillion on Indian stock exchanges and announced the award of a major contract with the Department of Transport and Planning in Victoria, Australia.
title: HCLTech hit by ransomware attack, IT major says investigation underway

summary: The city of Skokie, Illinois, was hit by a cyberattack that took down its computer network, and officials spent more than $42,000 on computer equipment and IT consultants following the Dec. 18 incident. Employees have been instructed not to release information about the incident to the public, while the city's assistant manager has promised to notify anyone involved if the investigation reveals that personal data was compromised.
title: Cyberattack Shuts Down Skokie Network, Staff Told To Keep It Secret | Skokie, IL Patch

summary: The GvW firm suffered a cyberattack that temporarily blocked access to some of its IT systems, including email communication, but no customer data was disclosed. The firm quickly restored its operations using pre-existing security measures and informed the relevant authorities, while promising to notify affected individuals if illegal data access was discovered. Details of the attack are being withheld due to ongoing investigations, but similar ransomware cases have been reported at other law firms.
title: GvW quickly survives cyber attack | juve.de

summary: Serbian power generation company Elektroprivreda Srbije (EPS) suffered an unprecedented cyber attack by a crypto virus, but claimed that electricity production and distribution as well as business activities were not affected thanks to the protective measures put in place. EPS computer systems have been temporarily taken down to eliminate the virus, and the relevant authorities have been informed and are taking appropriate action.
title: Serbia’s power utility EPS under unprecedented hacker attack

summary: Socadis, a major book distributor in Quebec, was the victim of a phishing cyberattack, leading to the shutdown of its operations and the shutdown of its communications systems. The attack comes during the holiday season, crucial for book sales, and could cause stock shortages if the situation is not resolved quickly. The incident highlights the book industry's vulnerability to cyberattacks, as evidenced by a similar attack on the Indigo bookstore chain earlier this year, and prompts urgent consideration of the security of IT systems in the sector.
title: A cyberattack would paralyze Socadis, one of the largest book distributors in Quebec | The duty

summary: The Luxembourg Trade Union Confederation (LCGB) was the victim of a cyberattack on December 16, resulting in a limited data leak, the exact extent and nature of which is still being assessed. Following the incident, a crisis headquarters was established and enhanced security measures were introduced to restore and protect the IT infrastructure. The LCGB informed the relevant authorities and the central committee, and a complaint was filed with the Grand Ducal police, although it appears that the personal data of employees and members was not copied.
title: Incident on December 16th LCGB reports cyber attack on the union's IT system - extent is still being investigated - Tageblatt.lu

summary: Yakult Australia, maker of a probiotic milk drink, has confirmed it was the victim of a "cyber incident", following the leak of 95GB of data claimed by the cybercriminal group DragonForce. The attack, which occurred in mid-December, affected the company's IT systems in Australia and New Zealand, but offices remain open and operational. DragonForce released data including company databases, contracts, passports and other sensitive documents, after attempting to extort the company which refused to cooperate.
title: Yakult Australia confirms 'cyber incident' after 95 GB data leak

summary: The Restoconnect platform, used for booking meals in school canteens in Nîmes, has been inaccessible since December 14 following a cyberattack against Dupont Restauration, the service manager. No personal data was compromised, but the incident caused difficulties for families who can no longer book or receive invoices. The mayor of Nîmes announced a staggering of payments to ease the financial burden on families once the platform is restored, without however specifying a date for a return to normal.
title: NÎMES Canteen reservation problem: the Restoconnect platform still inaccessible

summary: The company Verocard, which manages food vouchers for employees of Brumadinho town hall, was the victim of a cyberattack on December 14, leading to the unavailability of its services in several cities. Users were advised to avoid any transactions with their cards until the problem was resolved and the company announced it was taking legal action against the perpetrators of the attack. As a result, municipal employees are temporarily unable to access funds on their cards, disrupting their daily transactions and financial management.
title: Cyber ​​attack compromises the use of Verocard by Brumadinho servers

summary: Japanese company Ofuji Fishing Tackles suffered a ransomware cyberattack on December 13, 2023, leading to the possible leak of customers' personal information, including names, addresses, dates of birth and phone numbers, potentially affecting up to 200,000 people. . Although no evidence of data theft has been found, the company cannot rule out this possibility and apologizes for the inconvenience caused, while strengthening its security measures to prevent future attacks.
title: Report and apology regarding the possibility of personal information leakage | News | Ofuji Fishing Tackle Co., Ltd.

summary: The automatic storage system at the Western Railway workshop in Lower Parel, Mumbai, which deals with maintenance of long-distance train coaches, fell victim to a ransomware attack on December 13. Since the attack, the system has been forced to operate in manual mode, significantly slowing down the process of locating necessary spare parts. No specific ransom amount was demanded, but a message on the server indicated that it was a cyberattack, and efforts are underway to restore the system, with an expected resolution within the week.
title: Mumbai: Ransomware attack hits maintenance of train coaches at Lower Parel workshop | Mumbai News - Times of India

summary: MongoDB has warned that its enterprise systems have been compromised and customer metadata and contact information exposed following a cyberattack detected earlier this week. The company said data stored by customers in MongoDB Atlas was not affected, but the unauthorized access by the cyberattackers lasted for some time before being discovered. MongoDB recommends that all customers enable multi-factor authentication, change their passwords, and remain vigilant against potential targeted phishing attacks.
title: MongoDB says customer data was exposed in a cyberattack

summary: VF Corp, owner of the Vans brand, reported "unauthorized" activity on its IT systems on December 13, leading to disruptions in online order processing globally. The incident caused encryption of some systems and compromise of data, including personal data, and could have an ongoing material impact on the company's operations. Shares of VF Corp fell about 5% following the announcement, and the company has yet to assess the full financial impact of the attack.
title: Vans owner VF Corp's fulfillment operations hit by cyber incident -December 18, 2023 at 1:34 p.m. | Zonebourse

victim: Agência Nacional de Águas e Saneamento Básico (ANA)
summary: Brazil's Agência Nacional de Águas e Saneamento Básico (ANA) suffered a cyberattack that temporarily took down its systems, including the Water Resources User Portal, the Federal Regulatory System (REGLA), and the National Water Registry. users of water resources (CNARH), with no expected time frame for recovery. This is the second attack in two months, the previous one having led the agency to isolate its systems to contain the incident.
title: National Water and Sanitation Agency suffers new cyber attack | Security Report

summary: The London Public Library is experiencing a major systems outage, affecting services such as telephone, email, WIFI, website, catalog and digital resources in several of its branches. Three branches of the library will close early and remain closed for the remainder of the week, resulting in the cancellation of all programs. Library officials have not yet determined whether the outage was caused by a cyberattack, but an investigation is underway by IT teams.
title: Major systems outage impacting London Public Library | CTV News

summary: A cyberattack hit Limburg.net, leading to the closure of the unmonitored Kortessem recycling yard. Other recycling parks operated by Limburg.net remain open, but have to operate offline, causing inconvenience as users can no longer register digitally and employees have to carry out tasks manually. This complicates certain operations, such as weighing on weighbridges.
title: Cyber ​​attack on Limburg.net: Kortessem's unmanned recycling park closed | VRT NWS: news

summary: Hotelplan UK, a company operating multiple travel brands, was the victim of a cyberattack which led to the temporary closure of its key systems for investigation and recovery. CEO Joe Ponte assured that holidays and trips already booked would not be affected, while apologizing for any delays and saying the team is working around the clock to restore full service. Temporary solutions are being put in place to limit disruptions, but delays may occur in the coming days.
title: Hotelplan UK struck by cyber attack | Travel Weekly

summary: The March district was the target of a cyberattack, forcing authorities to shut down their entire IT system to protect data. It is not yet clear when the system will be operational again, and it could take several days. Currently, Bezirk March cannot be reached by telephone, but scheduled hearings at the District Court will take place as scheduled.
title: Cyberattack on the March district | Region

summary: The Milton Town School District was hit by a ransomware attack on Monday, December 11, resulting in the encryption and locking of several files on the MTSD server. Although the financial audit was disrupted, financial software and banking information as well as student records remained intact. The district has collaborated with various organizations for a rapid response and is working to securely restore locked files, while keeping education-critical systems operational.
title: Ransomware cyber attack hits Milton Town School District | Local News | miltonindependent.com

summary: The Central Bank of Lesotho has been the target of a cyberattack which has led to the suspension of some of its systems to prevent further infiltration, which could lead to delays in payments. No financial losses have been reported, but the incident raises concerns about the stability of the country's financial system and its effects on trade with South Africa.
title: Lesotho central bank 'targeted' in cyber attack attempt

'information. CACG teams, aided by cybersecurity experts, are working to restore affected services and have isolated networks to contain the attack, while collaborating with the relevant authorities. summary: Dameron Hospital in Stockton is investigating a cyberattack that resulted in the postponement of some medical procedures. summary: Following a cyberattack on the city of Baden in December, where data was stolen, around sixty citizens contacted a crisis unit set up, with ten people affected by the theft of personal data. victim: Indigo Sky Casino & Resort et Outpost Casino

title: AUSL Modena - Hacker attack on the systems of the three Modena healthcare companies

United States on November 20. The company is investigating the incident with the help of cybersecurity experts and has taken steps to contain the damage, including taking some systems offline. Experts from the Regional Criminal Investigation Bureau are currently examining the incident, and although the company's internal services are severely affected, there is currently no indication that customer data has been compromised.

FNF notified authorities and took steps to assess and contain the incident, although the material impact of the attack on the company remains undetermined.

A crisis unit has been set up and will remain active throughout the weekend to restore a secure IT system, and an emergency contact has been provided for technical needs.

Administrative functioning is severely limited, and updates will be provided on the website and social media.

summary: International Shoppes, LLC and Diplomatic Duty Free Shops of New York, Inc. experienced a cybersecurity incident on December 1, 2023, affecting their computer systems containing personal information. title: Notice of Data Security Breach
