title: Michael Garron Hospital dealing with data security incident | CP24.com

summary: Advarra, a company providing integrated solutions for clinical research, was the victim of a cyberattack on October 25, during which data was exfiltrated. The attackers threatened to release the data, claiming to have obtained more than 120 GB of confidential data belonging to current and former customers, patients and employees. Advarra responded by stating that they had taken steps to contain the attack and believed the matter was contained, while continuing to investigate with third-party cybersecurity experts.
title: Exclusive: Advarra hacked, threat actors threatening to leak data (1)

summary: Yamaha Motor Philippines (YMPH) was the victim of a cyberattack on October 25, in which a server was infected with ransomware and personal information of employees was partially leaked. The company reported the incident to Philippine authorities and is working with a countermeasures team and an external internet security company to investigate and prevent further damage. Yamaha confirmed that the attack was limited to a YMPH server and did not affect the headquarters or other companies of the Yamaha Motor Group.
title: Yamaha Motor PH victimized by cyber attack

victim: Les Éleveurs de porcs du Québec
summary: Quebec pig breeders were victims of a cyberattack on October 24, paralyzing the activities of their association and depriving them of income. The incident resulted in some data being compromised by an unauthorized third party and affected all systems, including those for breeders, slaughterhouses and transporters. The association has opened an investigation into the incident and has begun to notify people potentially affected by the leak of confidential information.
title: Pig farmers victims of cyberattack | The Press

summary: Mangaung Metro Municipality's information system fell victim to a ransomware cyberattack, rendering all applications used by the municipality inaccessible, including the financial system, human resources system, telephones, emails and... Internet access for all users. The cyberattack had a negative impact on service delivery, making payments to service providers and for tools and commerce difficult, and affecting the interaction between the municipality, community and other stakeholders. The municipality is working to recover the system and implement a recovery plan with the intention of restoring all critical services.
title: Bloemfontein metro goes dark after cyber attack | News24

summary: The CaseWorks electronic document management system, hosted by Clay County and used by other social service agencies in Minnesota, was targeted by a ransomware attack, discovered on October 27 and announced on December 22. Personal and health data of people who received social services was stolen between October 23 and 26, including names, social security numbers, addresses, dates of birth, and other sensitive information. Clay County offers credit monitoring services to affected individuals and advises monitoring account statements and credit reports for fraudulent or suspicious activity
title: Clay County-run social services system hit by ransomware attack - InForum | Fargo, Moorhead and West Fargo news, weather and sports

summary: The Veneto region announced that a computer attack, which began early in the morning, disrupted the IT infrastructures of the regional health system, in particular the Azienda Ospedaliera di Verona. User data is safe, but President Zaia asked people to only go to emergency services in an emergency.
title: Hacker attack on the Verona hospital, "don't go if you don't have an emergency": systems in haywire

summary: The EHPAD "Les Hortensias" in Marigny-le-Lozon was the victim of a cyberattack by the cybercriminal collective "Medusa", which revealed certain residents' data and demanded a ransom of $100,000. Documents such as ID cards and invoices have been published on the darknet. The establishment has filed a complaint and is working to secure its servers, while continuing to provide care to residents.
title: Manche: Marigny-le-Lozon EHPAD victim of a cyberattack, residents' data revealed - France Bleu

summary: Chilean telecommunications giant Grupo GTD was the victim of a cyberattack by the Rorschach ransomware gang, affecting its Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) platform and disrupting its online services. The attack impacted several services, including data centers, Internet access and Voice over IP (VoIP). Rorschach ransomware, also known as BabLock, was used to exploit DLL sideloading vulnerabilities in legitimate executables from Trend Micro, BitDefender, and Cortex XDR to load a malicious DLL.
title: Chilean telecom giant GTD hit by the Rorschach ransomware gang

summary: A cybersecurity threat caused all classes at Allen Park Public Schools to close on Monday. John Tafelski, the assistant superintendent for curriculum and instruction, sent a letter to members of the school community on Sunday, saying the school district had recently discovered a cybersecurity incident that had affected some of its systems.
title: Detroit-Area District Cancels Classes Due to Cyber Incident

summary: The town hall of Coronel Fabriciano in Brazil was the victim of a cyberattack on October 23, affecting its administrative systems and bureaucratic services. However, thanks to the security protocols in place, no data leaks have been recorded and no ransomware has been used by cybercriminals. The town hall is currently working to securely restore its systems with the help of systems company Sonner and cloud backup company Unitec.
title: Cyber ​​Attack: Fabriciano City Hall says there were no data leaks | Radio Itatiaia

summary: Río Hondo Community College in California suffered a cyberattack that limited its functions for several days. The school was added to the list of victims of the LockBit ransomware group, which gave officials until November 20 to pay an undisclosed ransom. This is the 69th attack of this type on a university or college this year, a record which far exceeds the 44 attacks observed in 2022.
title: California community college Río Hondo dealing with cybersecurity incident

summary: Trinidad and Tobago's South-West Regional Health Authority (SWRHA) has denied paying $7 million in bitcoin to hackers to regain access to its data following a cyberattack on October 23. The authority said it had not received any requests for payment and was able to continue its essential services using backup data sources. SWRHA is working with partner agencies to identify those responsible for the attack and plans to fully restore its automated operations on November 20.
title: SWRHA denies paying US$7m to hackers - Trinidad and Tobago Newsday

summary: On December 21, 2023, First Choice Dental reported a data breach to the Office for Civil Rights of the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services after discovering unauthorized access to confidential patient information. The company has secured its systems and is working with a cybersecurity firm to investigate the incident, which was made public the same day on their website, and plans to send notification letters to those affected. First Choice Dental is a dental practice based in Madison, Wisconsin, with 11 clinics and more than 109 employees, generating approximately $10 million in annual revenue.
title: First Choice Dental Files Notice of Data Breach with HHS-OCR Following Apparent Cyberattack | Console and Associates, P.C. - JDSupra

victim: Heart of Texas Behavioral Health Network (HOTBHN)
summary: The Heart of Texas Behavioral Health Network (HOTBHN) suffered a cyberattack affecting the sensitive data of 63,776 individuals, with information such as names, addresses, social security numbers and medical information potentially exposed. The DragonForce group claimed responsibility for the attack, claiming to have extracted around 56 GB of data. HOTBHN has strengthened its security measures and is offering credit monitoring and identity theft protection services to affected individuals.
title: Heart of Texas Behavioral Health Network Cyberattack Affects 63,776 Individuals

summary: Five hospitals in southwestern Ontario have been hit by a cyberattack, resulting in the shutdown of online services such as patient records and emails, according to their IT service provider, TransForm. As a result, patients with scheduled appointments will be contacted to reschedule or make alternate arrangements. TransForm is currently investigating the cause and extent of the incident, including whether patient information was affected.
title: 5 southwestern Ontario hospitals hit by cyberattack, patient appointments to be rescheduled | CBC News

summary: The town hall of Araguari and nine other municipalities were victims of a cyberattack which erased their data, disrupting communication between services and leading to the loss of the register of residents. The company providing the services is working to resolve the problem, which mainly affected the accounting management system. In response to the attack, Araguari City Hall is focusing on hiring new strategies to improve its data protection, including cloud backup and redundancy.
title: Cyber ​​attack erases data from Araguari City Hall and nine other municipalities - Latest News

summary: The radiology practice Plaza Radiology, operating as Chattanooga Imaging, suffered a data breach affecting 569,000 patients following a cyberattack discovered on October 21. Although the list of exposed data has not yet been disclosed, practice has confirmed that files containing sensitive information, including social security numbers, were accessed by an unauthorized party.
title: Radiology practice experiences cyberattack impacting 569,000 patients

summary: Clark County detected suspicious activity on its network on Saturday, October 21, and its IT department is investigating the situation. Portions of the County website, including the Property Information Center and Geographic Information Services, are currently unavailable. This incident briefly delayed processing voter registration updates, but the Election Management System and Voter Registration Database, part of VoteWA, a system managed by the Secretary of State's Office, did not were not affected.
title: Clark County investigating suspicious activity on countywide network | Clark County

summary: The social landlord Habitat Audois was the victim of a cyberattack on October 21, leading to the shutdown of access to emails and the inability to reach the telephone switchboard. Although the return to normal activity cannot yet be dated, a gradual recovery is hoped for in the coming weeks. In the meantime, several numbers have been set up to allow tenants to contact the office for various issues.
title: Aude: social landlord Habitat Audois targeted by a cyberattack, gradual return to normal - lindependant.fr

summary: Primary Health & Wellness Center, LLC, located in Baltimore County, Maryland, issued a public advisory advising of a ransomware attack that occurred on October 20, 2023, which encrypted their server containing the medical records of 4,792 patients since 2018 The threat actor used Phobos ransomware to encrypt the server via remote desktop, but there is no indication that patient data was exfiltrated or misused. The center has taken steps to secure the network, notified the FBI, and advises patients to monitor their credit reports to prevent fraud and identity theft.
title: Primary Health & Wellness Center, LLC’s public notice of ransomware incident

summary: The Museum für Naturkunde Berlin, a research institute for evolution and biodiversity, was the victim of a cyberattack, the extent of which is currently being analyzed by a crisis unit in collaboration with the competent authorities. Due to this attack, museum employees cannot be reached at their usual email address, but can be contacted by telephone. The museum is establishing a central telephone line to answer general visitor inquiries and will post updates on the situation on its website.
title: Museum of Natural History Berlin affected by cyber attack | Museum of Natural History

victim: Le bureau du procureur du comté d'Orange
summary: The Orange County District Attorney's Office has been the target of a cyberattack, shutting down its computer system, but the perpetrator of the attack remains unknown. The attack occurred Friday, and immediate steps were taken to shut down the computer system and prevent further intrusion. The office is working with a third-party expert to identify vulnerabilities in its computer systems and is coordinating with the FBI and the U.S. Attorney's Office to identify the perpetrators of the attack.
title: Orange County DA's Office Targeted by Cyberattack - MyNewsLA.com

summary: The Orion Township Public Library suffered a malware attack that required its systems to be temporarily shut down and restored. The attack, which took place over the weekend of October 20, was not targeted specifically against the library but exploited a weakness in its system and incurred significant labor costs. Library Director Chase McMunn recommends online security training for staff and mentions that resources for cybersecurity are available from the Michigan State Police and CISA.
title: Orion Library Tackles Malware Attack - Oakland County Times

summary: Glynn County government offices were the target of a computer 'incident' Thursday morning that impacted operations, including a county commission meeting later in the day. The Glynn County Information Technology (IT) Department detected the attack around 8:30 a.m. following reports of degraded services.
title: County IT department investigates security breach

summary: Cabo Verde Telecom, Cape Verde's state telecommunications operator, has implemented more than 10 measures to strengthen its security after a computer attack last week, according to the Lusa news agency. The company also benefits from the assistance of an international security company.
title: Cabo Verde Telecom takes security measures after cyber attack

summary: The Austrian railway company WESTbahn suffered a cyberattack mainly affecting its administrative systems, without disrupting rail traffic. The hackers were able to access company, employee and customer data, although the company has not confirmed whether any information was stolen. WESTbahn recommends that its customers change their passwords and has set up a hotline for any questions relating to this attack.
title: WESTbahn: Cyber ​​incident in the IT systems - operations not affected | WESTbahn Management GmbH, 25.10.2023

summary: Already on September 13, cybercriminals had installed - without anyone's knowledge - a Trojan horse on the computer system of the Deegenberg clinic. It was only about four weeks later, on October 19, that the computer virus finally knocked out the entire computer system, Professor Peter Deeg explained in an interview with the writing about the hacker attack on his rehabilitation clinic.
title: Bad Kissingen: Cyber ​​criminals attack Deegenberg clinic and demand ransom

summary: A recent computer attack in Dallas County may have compromised personal information. Authorities are investigating to determine the extent of the incident and have increased security. It was claimed by the Play group on October 28.
title: Dallas County, Tx, systems targeted in October cyber attack | Fort Worth Star-Telegram

summary: Real Sociedad, a football club based in San Sebastián, was the victim of a cyberattack affecting several of its servers containing personal data of its subscribers, shareholders and fans. Compromised information includes first and last names, ID card numbers, email addresses, postal addresses, telephone numbers and bank account numbers. The club has taken steps to resolve the incident and informed the relevant authorities, including the Data Protection Agency.
title: Real Sociedad, victim of a cyber attack

summary: The New York State Gaming Commission has confirmed that its central operating system serving the state's slots was hit by a cybersecurity attack, leading to the closure of Jake's Casino, among other things. 58 in Islandia, Suffolk County, for several days.
title: Cyber attacks hit NY state casino operation, two Hudson Valley hospitals

summary: The Hopewell Area School District was the target of a sophisticated ransomware attack, the origin of which is still under investigation. Superintendent Dr. Jeff Beltz said substantial progress has been made in restoring the network and student devices have not been affected. David Hickton, founder and director of the Institute for Cyber ​​Law, Policy and Security at the University of Pittsburgh, noted that these attacks are increasingly common and can cost school districts anywhere from $50,000 to $1 million dollars per attack.
title: Hopewell Area School District ransomware attack impacts network

summary: A cyberattack affected some online services provided by the Cabarrus County Register of Deeds, including public online access to land records and indexes of births, deaths and marriages. In response to the incident, Cabarrus IT services managers implemented a response plan and briefly cut off the internal connection with the vendor as a precautionary measure. However, the Register of Deeds office at the government center was not affected and remains open for recording documents and other tasks.
title: Greensboro cyber attack takes down some Cabarrus Register of Deeds services

summary: Xfinity, a brand of Comcast Cable Communications, revealed that a cyberattack on one of its Citrix servers in October resulted in the theft of sensitive customer data, including hashed usernames and passwords, as well as as well as potentially other personal information. The company has asked users to reset their passwords and is continuing to analyze the extent of the data breach.
title: Xfinity discloses data breach after recent Citrix server hack

summary: Baselland Psychiatry in Switzerland was the victim of a cyberattack, during which a large part of its IT infrastructure was encrypted by hackers. As a result, IT systems have been shut down for security reasons and internal and external communication is currently limited. The cantonal authorities have been informed and specialists are currently working to resolve the problem, although the duration of this operation is not yet known.
title: IT systems shut down: Cyber ​​attack on Psychiatry Baselland | Basler Zeitung

summary: The consulting company Patriotisk Selskab has been the victim of a cyber attack resulting in a computer outage. This situation currently prevents the company from providing some services to its clients. However, the company's mobile phone and email systems remain operational, allowing members and partners to stay in touch.
title: Patriotic Society hit by cyber attack | LandbrugsAvisen

summary: The Hong Kong Ballet's website suffered a ransomware cyberattack, leading to unauthorized access to its internal IT systems. The ballet company said it does not yet know which files were accessed by the hackers because they were encrypted. The HKB launched an internal investigation, brought in external cybersecurity experts to assess the extent of the breach and implemented remediation measures, while working with the police and reporting the incident to the Office of the commissioner for the protection of personal data.
title: HK Ballet website in ransomware attack | The Standard

summary: The province of Perugia in Italy was the target of a cyberattack aimed at disrupting its services by encrypting data on its internal servers. Their cybersecurity team, with the help of the company in charge of their IT security, reacted quickly to counter the attack, thanks to a reinforced security system recently implemented. Postal police have been informed of the incident and are currently assisting in the investigation, while provincial offices remain open and assess the consequences of the attack.
title: Hacker attack on the Province, cybersecurity team intervened immediately

summary: Police in Harlingen, Texas, were the victims of a cyberattack by a Russian extortion group that encrypted local police data but was unable to steal any. Officials were able to recover all the data through a cloud backup and shut down the city's phone and internet services to protect the system. Authorities are rebuilding the data system and hope to return to normal by the end of the week.
title: Russian hackers attack Harlingen Police Department | MyRGV.com

summary: Petersen Health Care, a major U.S. nursing home operator, filed for bankruptcy after falling victim to cyberattacks and defaulting on government-backed loans, worsening its pre-existing financial difficulties. The Peoria, Ill.-based company operates more than 90 facilities and has accumulated more than $295 million in debt, including $45 million owed in health care facility loans insured by the Department of Housing. and U.S. Urban Development (HUD). Cyberattacks notably disrupted Petersen's operations, leading to the
title: Nursing home co. Petersen files for bankruptcy after cyberattacks | Reuters

summary: Kansas court systems, including Sedgwick County's, will likely operate on paper for at least the next two weeks. This measure is taken following a cyber attack. Switching to paper is a temporary solution to maintain court operations.
title: Kansas courts to operate on paper for at least 2 weeks, judge sa - KAKE

summary: WMCHealth Hospital in Kingston was forced to redirect patients to other hospitals for two days following a potential cyberattack. Although the hospital said patient care was not affected, Kingston mayoral candidate Scott Denny claimed the hospital had computer issues and failed to notify the public of the situation. The hospital confirmed it had alerted authorities and launched an investigation with the help of a third-party cybersecurity firm.
title: HAHV’s Kingston hospital diverts patients for two days without an announcement - Hudson Valley One

summary: Two New York hospitals fell victim to a cyberattack, forcing ambulances to divert to other facilities. The attack affected computer systems at HealthAlliance Hospital in Kingston, Margaretville Hospital and Mountainside Residential Care Center, all part of the Westchester Medical Center health network. The incident is currently under investigation by local authorities, the FBI and an independent cybersecurity firm.
title: Cyberattack hits 2 New York hospitals forces ambulance diversions - The Week

summary: Insurance giant American Family Insurance has confirmed it has been the victim of a cyberattack and has shut down parts of its computer systems after customers reported service disruptions to its website throughout the week.
title: American Family Insurance confirms cyberattack is behind IT outages

summary: Otsego Memorial Hospital in Gaylord, run by Munson Healthcare, suffered a cyber incident in October that shut down its computer system, with no evidence of patient data being compromised.
title: Cyber incident shuts down Otsego Memorial Hospital computers | Local News | record-eagle.com

summary: Henry Schein Inc., Long Island's largest publicly traded company, suffered a "cybersecurity incident" affecting some of its manufacturing and distribution operations. The company has taken precautionary measures, including taking some systems offline, which resulted in temporary disruption to some of its business operations. Henry Schein is working with cybersecurity and information technology experts to investigate the impact of the data and has informed legal authorities.
title: Henry Schein Inc. comes under cyberattack - Newsday

summary: The City of Hope, a California-based cancer treatment and clinical research center, was the victim of a cyberattack that compromised the protected health and personal information of 827,000 people. The suspicious activity was detected on October 13, 2023 and an investigation revealed unauthorized access to certain systems between September 19 and October 12, 2023, with exfiltration of data. The City of Hope has increased its security measures and is offering two years of credit monitoring and identity theft protection services to affected individuals.
title: City of Hope Cyberattack Affects 827,000 Individuals

victim: Service Départemental d'Incendie et de Secours des Pyrénées-Atlantiques (SDIS64)
summary: The Pyrénées-Atlantiques Departmental Fire and Rescue Service (SDIS64) was the victim of a cyberattack on October 12, 2023, affecting its IT and office infrastructure. Despite the attack, the activities of the firefighters and the emergency telephone service 18 were not impacted. A press conference is planned for October 13 in Pau with the presence of the public prosecutor, the Prefect, the President of SDIS64 and the director.
title: The Pyrénées-Atlantiques departmental fire and rescue service is the victim of a cyberattack | Béarn News

summary: Construction company Verhelst in Oudenburg suffered a cyber attack two weeks ago and is still feeling the effects, with a lot of computer data lost or still unusable. The company remains operational despite the disruption caused by the hack. The company's priority is to minimise the impact of the attack and continue to serve its customers securely.
title: Cyber ​​attack on Oudenburg construction company Verhelst | Focus and WTV

summary: Berlin's Natural History Museum was crippled by a ransomware cyberattack identified in mid-October, which left up to 450 employees unable to work by encrypting data and demanding a ransom for its decryption. A small emergency group is operational and a crisis service has been set up, while the perpetrators of the attack have asked the museum management to contact them. Despite the attack, the operation of the museum for visitors and online ticketing were not affected, as they are hosted on external servers.
title: Hundreds of employees offline for five weeks: Cyber ​​attack paralyzes Berlin's Natural History Museum

summary: Outpatient radiology and oncology company Akumin was the victim of a ransomware attack on October 11, disrupting its ability to provide services to its customers. Following suspicious activity observed on its computer network, the company had to shut down its systems. Akumin resumed treatment of some patients on October 13 and launched an investigation in collaboration with a cybersecurity advisor.
title: Akumin Service Disrupted By Cyberattack - MarketWatch

summary: The article reports on a cyberattack at Cogdell Memorial Hospital in Texas, where the personal and medical data of 87,000 patients was potentially compromised. The hospital secured its network and is investigating with a cybersecurity firm, but has not offered credit monitoring or identity theft protection services to victims. The attack was claimed a month later by Lorenz.
title: Cogdell Memorial Hospital Cyberattack Affects 87,000 Patients

summary: Simpson Manufacturing Co., a producer of construction and engineering materials, was the victim of a cyberattack Tuesday that disrupted its IT infrastructure and applications. The Pleasanton, Calif.-based company has retained third-party experts to support an investigation and recovery efforts. The investigation to assess the nature and extent of the incident is still ongoing and is in its early stages.
title: Simpson Manufacturing says it was hit by a cyber attack on Tuesday, is working to investigate | Morningstar

summary: The recent shutdown of the website was caused by a cyberattack that resulted in significant damage. Onyphe data highlights the use of JetBrain's TeamCity, in a version affected by the CVE-2023-42793 vulnerability, known to be actively exploited in these cyberattacks.
title: Downtime and Maintenance Update - Admin Announcements - Pride of Nottingham (Notts County Community)

summary: On October 10, 2023, Cofrac's IT infrastructure suffered a cyberattack, rendering its information system partially inoperable despite the security mechanisms in place. No data leak has been noted at this stage and teams are working to restore service. The accreditation information on the site is no longer updated since the date of the attack.
title: A cyberattack targets Cofrac

summary: De La Salle University (DLSU) in Manila suffered a cyberattack affecting its locally hosted applications, but without compromising student records or cloud-hosted applications, according to an official statement. In response to the incident, DLSU hired cybersecurity firm Mandiant to assist in the investigation and recovery of its systems, and took preventative measures like changing passwords and enabling authentication multi-factor. Following the attack, some classes have been moved online until further notice.
title: DLSU hit by cyberattack, shifts some classes online - Technobaboy

summary: Convenience store chain Kwik Trip has reported widespread outages affecting its services at more than 800 stores in the United States, following a "network incident." The technology issues began Monday, affecting the company's app, rewards system and phone service. While the company confirmed the outages were the result of an "incident," it did not respond to requests for comment on the possibility of a ransomware attack.
title: Kwik Trip says ‘network incident’ causing disruptions at stores

summary: The Telecommunications Service of Trinidad and Tobago (TSTT) said an attempted ransomware cyberattack on its systems failed. According to a release, TSTT activated its incident response processes from the onset of the threat, successfully isolating and rebuilding its systems. Despite allegations that personal files were exfiltrated and posted on the dark web, Public Services Minister Marvin Gonzales and TSTT have denied any breach of their security systems.
title: TSTT on ransomware attack: Hackers tried but failed - Trinidad and Tobago Newsday

summary: Prescription fulfillment company Sav-Rx announced a data breach affecting 2.8 million people in the United States, after a cyberattack took place in October 2023. Stolen information includes names, dates of birth , social security numbers, email addresses, physical addresses and telephone numbers. Sav-Rx has implemented new security measures and is offering two years of identity protection and credit monitoring to affected individuals.
title: Sav-Rx discloses data breach impacting 2.8 million Americans

summary: Volex plc, a specialist manufacturer of critical power and data transmission products, has been the victim of a cyber attack which led to unauthorized access to some of its IT and data systems across the group's international locations. The company quickly responded by activating its IT security protocols, hiring external consultants to investigate the incident, and so far the anticipated financial impact is not considered significant, with minimal operational continuity affected.
title: Volex - Regulatory News

summary: The Western Vosges hospital center suffered a cyberattack during the night from Friday to Saturday, disrupting access to computerized patient files and forcing the establishment to suspend its scheduled activities until Monday. In response to the attack, the hospital had to “cyber-contain” itself, that is to say, shut down all its information systems and return to the use of paper forms. The director, Dominique Cheveau, indicates that the return to normal could take days or even weeks, but hopes for a gradual resumption of activities from Tuesday.
title: Vittel and Neufchâteau hospitals victims of cyberattack - France Bleu

summary: During routine checks at the Universitätsklinikum Frankfurt, preparations for a possible hacker attack were detected, leading to the hospital's network being disconnected from the Internet as a security measure. External teams and the internal IT department are currently working to assess the damage and restore systems, which is expected to take several weeks. However, the hospital's core systems continue to operate normally, and no data loss has been reported so far.
title: Hacker attack on university hospital in Frankfurt: disconnected from the Internet

summary: Construction archive site Weblager.dk was the victim of a cyberattack, affecting access to construction records for around 50 Danish municipalities. Dansk Scanning, the company that runs the service, confirmed that the attack caused major technical issues, forcing the site to temporarily shut down. It is not yet clear when the site will be operational again.
title: Affected by cyber attack: 50 municipalities affected - Ekstra Bladet

summary: The Clark County School District (CCSD) announced that a recent cyberattack allowed an “unauthorized party” to access personal information of some students, parents and employees. The incident, discovered on October 5, involved the district's email environment, which immediately called in a team of experts to investigate. Affected individuals will receive a notification letter in the mail, and no reports of identity theft related to the incident have been reported to date.
title: Personal information accessed in CCSD cybersecurity incident

summary: On December 4, 2023, Neurosurgical Associates of New Jersey reported a data breach after a hacker accessed an employee email account, exposing sensitive patient information such as names, addresses, social security numbers, information health insurance, medical records and treatment history. The company has secured its systems and is working with data security specialists to assess the impact of the incident. Data breach notification letters will be sent to affected individuals once the investigation is complete.
title: Neurosurgeons of New Jersey Confirms Cyber Attack Resulting in Recent Data Breach | Console and Associates, P.C. - JDSupra

summary: German municipal companies Hochsauerlandenergie and Hochsauerlandwasser were victims of a cyberattack in early October, which led to the suspension of their services. Systems are now restored and almost all services are available to customers again. The companies refused to pay the ransom demanded by the hackers and filed a lawsuit against the perpetrators of the attack.
title: Hochsauerlandenergie: Service is working again - Radio Sauerland

summary: The Metro transit system in St. Louis suffered a cyberattack that disrupted some of its services, including paratransit service Call-A-Ride. Metro's IT team was able to contain the breach and protect customer information, no customer data was compromised. Although bus and MetroLink services were not affected, Call-A-Ride service was only able to provide vital appointments, such as dialysis treatments.
title: Call-A-Ride service should be back to normal Wednesday, Metro says | FOX 2

summary: Estes Express Lines, a transportation company based in Richmond, Virginia, confirmed that it was the victim of a cyberattack that disrupted its core infrastructure and several of its systems. Despite the attack, the company continues to collect and deliver goods. The article also highlights that the transportation industry is among the top ten industries in terms of the number of companies experiencing data breaches, according to a recent NordPass study.
title: Estes Express victim of cyberattack | Commercial Carrier Journal

summary: The Karlsruhe Hochschule was the target of a cyberattack, the identity of the perpetrators remains unknown and efforts are underway to restore the IT systems. Despite the attack, classes and services continued as normal, with additional information provided to students through various means. This is not the first time that Karlsruhe has been hit by such attacks, with eight schools having already been hacked in February.
title: Cyberattack on Karlsruhe University: Classes continued for students on Wednesday

summary: The province of Cosenza was the victim of a ransomware attack that encrypted data on some computers, but the central system remained unscathed. The president assured that the administration has not given in to the ransom demand, working to resolve the problem to restore digital activities by Thursday or Friday.
title: Hacker attack on the Province of Cosenza, pirates demand a ransom

summary: Degenia Versicherungsdienst, was the victim of a computer hack. In response to this incident, the company temporarily took its IT infrastructure offline. No details on the nature of the attack or any damage sustained were provided, and the company is working with authorities to assess the damage and minimize disruption.
title: Cyber ​​criminals paralyze Degenia IT

victim: Le Premier Circuit Judiciaire de Floride
summary: The First Judicial Circuit of Florida suffered a computer security incident that significantly affects its operations in Escambia, Okaloosa, Santa Rosa and Walton counties. This event results in the cancellation and postponement of certain legal proceedings, as well as the suspension of certain related operations for several days beginning Monday, October 2, 2023. An active investigation is underway to resolve this incident.
title: The First Judicial Circuit of Florida dealing with significant infosecurity incident

summary: A cyberattack at the beginning of October targeted the Transcarte site, used to manage free transport subscriptions for seniors in Yvelines, preventing the renewal of Amethyst Cards. Although the attack was thwarted without any compromise of personal data, the platform became unusable, forcing a return to the use of paper forms and causing significant delays. Users, like Josette from Mantes-la-Jolie, find themselves unable to benefit from their free subscription, causing frustration and financial difficulties for some.
title: Yvelines: a computer attack paralyzes the subscription to free transport for seniors | 78actu

summary: Mobile operator Lyca Mobile UK has confirmed that it has been the victim of a cyberattack, responsible for recent disruptions to its services in the United Kingdom. Customers experienced issues making calls, sending text messages, and contacting customer support. The operator said mobile telecommunications services affected by this attack have been restored, but there are still operational services to resolve and an investigation is underway to determine whether personal data was compromised.
title: Lyca Mobile UK Confirm Cyber Attack Responsible for Disruption - ISPreview UK

summary: On September 29, 2023, Cardiovascular Consultants, a subsidiary of Fresenius Medical Care AG in the United States, noted a security breach affecting certain IT systems. Data was encrypted and stolen by an intruder, affecting electronic health records and the data warehouse, potentially affecting approximately 500,000 patients, former patients, guarantors and 200 employees. An agency was hired to notify patients, provide call center services and monitor the credit of those affected. An investigation into the impact on another subsidiary, Fresenius Vascular Care, Inc., is ongoing.

summary: Hackers managed to access the sensitive personal information of numerous players and employees at Rivers Casino in Illinois during a cyberattack that occurred in mid-August, but was only discovered in early November. Potentially compromised data includes social security numbers, addresses, dates of birth and driver's license numbers. The casino has taken steps to contain the threat and secure its systems, and there are no signs yet of fraud or identity theft following the breach.
title: Hackers get social security numbers, other info in Rivers Casino cyberattack - Chicago Sun-Times

summary: The Golden Corral restaurant chain suffered a data breach in August 2023, affecting the personal information of approximately 183,000 people, including current and past customers and employees. After discovering the incident, Golden Corral notified federal authorities, launched an investigation and implemented additional security measures, also providing 24 months of credit monitoring services to those affected. This incident is part of a series of recent cyber attacks targeting critical infrastructure, highlighting a rise in data breaches across various sectors.
title: Golden Corral Restaurant Discloses Data Breach Affecting 183,000 People | Tech Times

summary: The company Neogy, which installs charging stations for electric cars in South Tyrol, was the victim of a cyberattack. Hackers managed to steal customer data such as name, address, phone number, email and password. According to media reports, the password is encrypted and therefore difficult to access. However, Neogy recommends its customers to change their password immediately. In the coming weeks, the South Tyrolean company plans to update its user portal and app.
title: Hacker attack on South Tyrolean e-charging station supplier Neogy - South Tyrol News

summary: Freeport-McMoRan Inc., a major international mining company, is investigating a cybersecurity incident affecting its information systems. The company assesses the impact of the incident and implements proactive measures to address it, in collaboration with third-party experts and law enforcement. So far, the incident has had a limited impact on production. Transitional solutions are being planned and implemented to secure information systems as quickly as possible. A prolonged disruption could affect the company's future operations.
title: Freeport-McMoRan Inc. - Freeport-McMoRan Investigating Cybersecurity Incident

summary: A ransomware cyberattack disrupted Rapattoni's Multiple Listing Service (MLS), a vital online tool for real estate agents, making new property listings and open houses unfindable and some data inaccessible. The attack took place on Wednesday and affected service across the country. Megan Pomponio, a real estate agent, said the MLS outage limited the information available, delaying listings and communication between agents and brokers. BAREIS, the regional MLS for Marin County, said it could be several days before the issue is resolved. In the meantime, alternative solutions have been proposed to allow brokers
title: Bay Area realty agents frustrated after cyber attack hobbles MLS

summary: The Verdeil Foundation, the largest semi-governmental institution for minors in the canton of Vaud, was the victim of a cyberattack on August 8, with an encrypted server and disruptions in operations, particularly in offices and the communication. Executive Director Corinne Noth confirmed that the organization immediately contacted its IT service providers, security specialists and local and federal authorities. Cybercriminal group "NoEscape" claimed responsibility for the attack, claiming to have stolen 40 GB of data, including medical documents, photos of children and other sensitive information. An ultimatum is in
title: Cyberattack on the largest special education facility in the canton of Vaud

summary: Mayanei Hayeshua Medical Center in Israel was the victim of a cyberattack that disrupted its services, including disabling computer record-keeping systems. The perpetrators of the attack have not yet been identified. Due to the attack, the hospital is not accepting new patients in outpatient clinics and imaging centers. A report found that Israeli hospitals were "significantly hacked" 13 times, with 10 of those hacks being "of the most severe level." The report recommends that the Ministry of Health take a more active role in enforcing health standards
title: Israel hospital hacking disrupts services; Cyberattackers unknown - Israel News - The Jerusalem Post

summary: The national veterinary, agri-food and food school of Nantes, Oniris, was the victim of a cyberattack on Monday August 7. The data copied by the attackers includes the first and last names and professional email addresses of the establishment's staff. A complaint was filed and a personal data breach notification was sent to the National Commission for Information Technology and Liberties. The school assured that no data encryption or ransomware was detected and locked down its computer system, rendering Oniris email addresses unusable. Despite the attack, telephone lines and
title: Nantes veterinary school hit by cyberattack

victim: Le Service de Santé de Madeira (Sesaram)
summary: The Madeira Health Service (Sesaram) in Portugal was the target of a cyberattack which caused a “malfunction of its computer network”, leading to the suspension of non-urgent clinical activities. The attack was described as deliberate and malicious, aimed at disrupting the normal operation of the regional health service. The internal functioning of the organization was affected, in particular the emergency department of the Dr. Nélio Mendonça Hospital in Funchal. The incident was reported to the National Cybersecurity Center and the National Data Protection Commission, and was reported to the competent police authorities. Sesaram works
title: Cyberattack forces suspension of clinical activity in the Madeira Health Service - Society - Correio da Manhã

summary: Hackers linked to Russia stole highly confidential information in an attack on British perimeter security company Zaun. The leaked data includes details of sensitive military and intelligence sites in the UK, such as the HMNB Clyde nuclear submarine base and the Porton Down chemical weapons laboratory. The leak also includes information on security equipment at other military sites, drawings of perimeter fencing, and data relating to prisons. This national security breach raises concerns about the vulnerability of computer systems and the security of sensitive sites.
title: Russia linked hackers hit UK Ministry of Defence as security secrets leaked

summary: Trinkwserverband (TWV) Stader Land, a water supplier in Germany, suffered a cyberattack that caused “technical disruptions” and affected its messaging systems. Although water supply is critical infrastructure, the TWV has assured that water supply has not been affected. The hackers reportedly used ransomware called "LockBit", which is typically used to target businesses and authorities. However, it appears that the hackers did not encrypt any data to demand a ransom for its release.
title: Hackers cause "technical disruptions": Cyber ​​attack on the Stade - Horneburg drinking water association

summary: The computer systems of Crozer Health, located in Delaware County, fell victim to a ransomware attack by the company's owner, Prospect Medical Holdings Inc. Ransomware is a type of malware that encrypts files, rendering it unusable until a financial demand is met. In June 2020, Crozer was previously the victim of a malware attack, and some Crozer data was put up for auction after the company refused to pay a ransom. The healthcare industry is the most popular target for cyberattacks because it contains personal information such as names and addresses, ages and
title: Ransomware hits Crozer Health and its owner Prospect Medical Holdings

victim: Commission des services électriques de Montréal (CSEM)
summary: The Montreal Electric Services Commission (CSEM) was the victim of a cyberattack by the LockBit gang on August 3, who demanded a ransom of two million US dollars, which the CSEM refused. The attack affected Montreal's underground electricity and telecommunications lines, causing outages the next day. Hackers stole EMSB records and are threatening to publish all the stolen data. The EMSB holds information about critical infrastructure, raising concerns about the potential impact of this information in the wrong hands. LockBit has been identified as the most active ransomware in 2022, having
title: Hackers attack critical underground infrastructure | The Press

victim: Commission des services électriques de Montréal (CSEM)
summary: The Montreal Electric Services Commission (EMSC) was the latest victim of the LockBit ransomware group’s attack. The organization confirmed the incident, which occurred on August 3, but refused to pay the ransom and appealed to national authorities and the Quebec police. Despite LockBit’s threat to release the stolen data, the EMSC downplayed the risk to public safety and its operations. Cybersecurity experts question the cybercrime group’s operational strength after its leaders disappeared in early August. Additionally, the reported leak of the LockBit 3 ransomware build tool
title: Montreal electricity organization latest victim in LockBit ransomware spree

summary: Campbell Soup Co. reported a cyber intrusion into part of its computer network at the end of its fiscal fourth quarter. The company immediately took steps to investigate, contain and eliminate the threat, hiring cybersecurity experts and notifying federal authorities. Although the attack resulted in a three-day outage at a plant in Ohio, the impact on the company's business was limited and did not have a material effect on financial results or operations of the company.
title: Campbell Soup says summer cyberattack caused limited business impact | Cybersecurity Dive

summary: Postgraduate law school BPP has been hit by a cyberattack, leaving students unable to access their course work as exams approach. BPP's systems have been infiltrated by an unauthorized third party. BPP is working with cybersecurity specialists to assess the incident and determine the nature and extent of the data affected. The majority of BPP's core systems and network infrastructure have been secured and restored. The National Cyber ​​Security Center has updated its guidelines for the legal sector, warning that it is a particular target for crimes such as "phishing" and attacks
title: Students 'locked out' as BPP hit by cyber attack | News | Law Gazette

summary: I'm sorry, but the article you provided does not contain information about a cyberattack. It appears to be a paywall page that offers different subscriptions to access the site's content. There are no details about a cyberattack against the Joyson automobile company in Aschaffenburg.
title: Cyber ​​attack on Aschaffenburg-based automotive supplier Joyson

summary: The German Federal Bar Association (BRAK), which represents German lawyers nationally and internationally, is investigating a cyberattack at its Brussels office. The attack was claimed by the NoEscape ransomware group. BRAK is working with an IT security company to analyze the incident and repair the damage. Hackers encrypted BRAK's email server and exfiltrated 160 gigabytes of data. The organization warns that people should be wary of emails claiming to come from the organization, especially those asking for bank account information.
title: Germany’s national bar association investigating ransomware attack

victim: Acadia Health, LLC d/b/a Just Kids Dental (JKD)
summary: On August 2, 2023, the computer systems and network of Acadia Health, LLC, known as 'Just Kids Dental' (JKD), were attacked by a malicious actor. A program was used to encrypt JKD's computer networks and data, including storage systems for certain patient and employee records. This attack was discovered on August 8, 2023.
title: Data Breach Notification

summary: The Integrated Medical Care Program (PAMI) in Argentina has confirmed that it has been the victim of a ransomware cyberattack, a virus that encrypts files to demand a ransom. Despite the attack, medical appointments are being maintained and medications can be purchased normally in pharmacies. PAMI said the attack has been mitigated and all information on their servers is secure and protected. Separately, a separate situation was reported where a group was selling PAMI prescriptions for narcotics, which was quickly deactivated following a tip-off. Finally, MP Graciela Ocaña asked
title: The PAMI confirmed a ransomware cyberattack: it took down the site, but they assure that "it was mitigated"

victim: Eastern Connecticut Health Network (ECHN) et Waterbury HEALTH
summary: The computer systems of Eastern Connecticut Health Network (ECHN) and Waterbury HEALTH were the victims of a cyberattack, resulting in a widespread outage. As a result, ECHN is diverting patients from its emergency rooms while Waterbury Hospital uses paper records. The FBI has confirmed that it is investigating a ransomware attack targeting some local medical facilities. The impact of the outage is affecting all operations internally and externally at Waterbury HEALTH, which may result in some appointments being rescheduled. Several ECHN facilities are closed until further notice due to IT issues.
title: Cyberattack suspected in computer system outage for Eastern Connecticut Health Network, Waterbury HEALTH - NBC Connecticut

summary: On the morning of August 1, 2023, NSF's NOIRLab detected a cyber incident in its computer systems, leading to the suspension of astronomical observations at Gemini North in Hawaii. NOIRLab cybersecurity teams and observation teams responded quickly to prevent any damage to the observatory. As a precautionary measure, we have decided to isolate the Gemini Observatory's computer systems by shutting them down. The Gemini website and proposal tools are currently offline, but the NOIRLab website remains online.
title: Cyber Incident at NSF’s NOIRLab

summary: On July 29, Pensiones Civiles del Estado (PCE) suffered a cyberattack that affected its digital services related to medical care, administration and economic benefits. As a result, PCE is implementing an alternative mechanism to meet the needs of beneficiaries without technological support. Experts are working on solving the problem in collaboration with technology companies and government authorities. PCE thanks users for their understanding and requests that they use the service only when necessary. All official information on the situation will be disseminated through official channels.
title: Jacarezinho suffers cyber attack | News | baguette

summary: The company Papel Prensa suffered a ransomware cyberattack which restricted access to its computer systems. The attack was reported to the Comisión Nacional de Valores (CNV), the regulatory authority for financial markets in Argentina. So far, no damage has been detected to files important to the operation of the company. Although production was not affected, administration, marketing, logistics and distribution departments were disrupted. The company is working to restore its systems, with some emails already restored.
title: Cyberattack on Papel Prensa: the company informed the National Securities Commission about the "data hijacking" | The opinion

summary: The Seiko Group company confirmed that it was the victim of unauthorized access to some of its servers on July 28, 2023. An investigation carried out by a specialized external organization revealed on August 2 that certain information from the company and the group could have been disclosed. The company is currently verifying the information stored on the compromised server. Seiko Group is committed to preventing further damage expansion and preventing future attacks. They apologize for the concerns and inconvenience caused and ask their customers and partners to contact them immediately if they receive suspicious emails or notifications.
title: Important Notice Details | Important Notices | Seiko Group

summary: Parathon by JDA eHealth Systems, a healthcare revenue cycle management company, confirmed that it was the victim of a cyberattack on July 27, 2023, during which patients' protected health information was compromised. accessed and 560GB of data was stolen by the Akira threat group, which has since removed mention of Parathon from its data leak site, suggesting the ransom has been paid. Parathon has implemented enhanced security measures and is offering credit monitoring services to affected individuals, although it has not found evidence of fraudulent use of the stolen data. It is not key
title: Parathon by JDA eHealth Systems Confirms July 2023 Cyberattack

summary: CardioComm, a Canadian company specializing in cardiac monitoring and medical electrocardiogram, was forced to take its systems offline following a cyberattack. This attack affected its production server environments and business operations. CardioComm said it is unlikely that sensitive customer information was lost in the attack because its software runs on individual customer systems. The company works with medical professionals to analyze cardiograms, but does not collect patient health information itself. Although the company did not give specific details on the type of cyberattack, it is likely that
title: OODA Loop - CardioComm Takes Systems Offline Following Cyberattack

summary: Softproject GmbH, a Germany-based BiPRO service provider, was the target of a ransomware cyberattack codenamed “CryTox.” The attack resulted in part of the company's application infrastructure being encrypted, although initial investigations did not reveal a data leak. Following the attack, Softproject took its software-as-a-service (SaaS) solutions offline as a precaution, which may have led to disruptions in BiPRO services between brokers and insurers. Softproject is currently working with a team of experts from Corporate Trust Business Risk & Crisis Management GmbH to fully restore its services
title: Brokers and insurers affected: Cyber ​​attack on BiPRO service providers | procontra

summary: On July 25, 2023, we confirmed that there was unauthorized access to our server. Currently, in order to prevent the spread of damage, we are blocking communication with the outside world and are investigating by external experts. It is expected to take some time to identify the equipment that received unauthorized access, investigate the cause of the unauthorized access, and recover it.
title: Notice of unauthorized access

summary: Last week, St. Landry Parish Schools were hit by a ransomware attack. Superintendent Milton Batiste III confirmed the attack and is currently working with Louisiana State Police to investigate. It is not yet clear what data was obtained in the attack, but screenshots show information available on the group's blog on the dark web. The hacker group is demanding a $1 million ransom to delete the stolen data.
title: SLPSB victimized in ransomware attack | News | theadvocate.com

summary: The Galician television company CRTVG has been the target of a sophisticated cyberattack. According to Rafael Villaverde, CEO of cloud.gal and cybersecurity expert, the attack likely started with a deceptive email that was clicked by an employee of the human resources department. Once access was gained, the cybercriminals likely encrypted all the documents, making them unreadable, and demanded a ransom for their decryption, usually in bitcoins. If the company has a backup, attackers move on to the data theft phase by massively copying the information to a server. In the case of CRTVG, approximately 500 GB
title: CRTVG cyber attack exposes sensitive data to global criminal networks - Public Square

summary: The City of Angoulême and GrandAngoulême were victims of a cyberattack this morning, leading to a complete interruption of the network and telephony. Despite this, services remain open at usual times. However, payment by credit card in cultural and children's facilities is currently impossible and the City's website is temporarily suspended. On the GrandAngoulême side, the examination of town planning files is suspended and the GrandAngoulême Habitat telephone reception is not available. The services of the agglomeration and the city are mobilized to deal with this cyberattack and are currently in the diagnosis phase.
title: ⚠️ [INFORMATION] 💻 This morning,... - City of Angoulême | Facebook

summary: The city of Jacarezinho, Brazil, was the target of a cyberattack that compromised the city hall's IT systems and database, disrupting the city's online services. The attack was reported to the authorities who are currently investigating the perpetrators and the motivations for the act. City Hall said it could not yet give a date for the systems to be fully restored. Affected services include the issuance of electronic invoices, tax payment guides, generation of municipal employee payroll and the transparency portal.
title: Jacarezinho suffers cyber attack | News | baguette

summary: The Radeberger Taubblindendienst, a German service for deaf and blind people, was the victim of a cyberattack which caused considerable damage. The attack was launched by malware that disabled antiviruses, cracked complex passwords and encrypted all of the organization's data. The director, Gerold Augart, refused to pay the ransom demanded by the hackers, who probably launched the attack from Korea or Russia. Rebuilding the systems took two weeks and cost around 10,000 euros.
title: Cyberattack on the Radeberg deafblind service: "It was sheer horror" | Sächsische.de

victim: Pierce College at Joint Base Lewis McChord
summary: Pierce College at Joint Base Lewis McChord said July 24 it was experiencing technical difficulties. The Rhysida group recently added the university to its list of victims.
title: none

summary: Tempur Sealy International Inc. announced that it identified a cybersecurity event affecting some of its IT systems on July 23. Following this attack, the company activated its incident response team to contain the incident. Tempur Sealy is currently working to determine whether this breach will have a material impact on its business or financial results. If Company discovers that Personal Information was involved, Company will endeavor to comply with all reporting obligations under applicable law. Despite this incident, the company's stock fell 0.6% in pre-opening but has gained 34% since the start of the year.
title: Tempur Sealy says its IT system was hacked in July - MarketWatch

summary: On July 24, Azimut acknowledged that unauthorized access to its systems had been detected, committed by unknown parties and not related to a malfunction of the systems themselves or to human error. Following this cyberattack, the Azimut Group received a ransom demand to which it did not respond, considering it criminal and totally contrary to the principles and values ​​of the Group, which has always been committed to fighting the financing of any criminal activity. The cyberattack had been claimed three days earlier by Alphv/Black Cat.
title: Note on Information security

summary: Victim of a computer attack, municipal services cannot be reached by telephone or email at the moment. Our services welcome you physically at the usual times.
title: Computer hacking: inaccessible services

summary: An architectural office based in Bern, which designed several Swiss representations abroad, was the victim of a cyberattack. Hackers have stolen sensitive information and are threatening to publish it. The criminal group behind the attack, known as Abyss, plans to release the data on September 1 if a ransom is not paid. The stolen documents include plans for objects from performances abroad, some of which are classified. This is the second time in a few weeks that the Swiss federal administration has been indirectly affected by a cyberattack.
title: Hacker attack: Sensitive data about Swiss embassies stolen

summary: The company was the victim of a cyberattack/virus. The company's data server was targeted by a ransomware attack, resulting in all data being encrypted. The technical team and management responded quickly and took the necessary precautions to mitigate the impact of this incident.
title: Cyber-Attack/Virus Incident On Server Of The Company

victim: Institut National de Recherche Spatiale (Inpe) du Brésil
summary: The website of Brazil's National Institute for Space Research (Inpe), which contains data on the fires, was attacked by hackers and is currently offline. According to the institute, the attack took place on July 20. However, the hacker only had access to the same information that is available to anyone accessing the portal. No sensitive or private information was compromised in this attack. The site's services are temporarily unavailable following this cyber attack.
title: Inpe website with data on fires is attacked by hackers and goes offline | Paraíba Valley and Region | G1

summary: The Danbury School District was the victim of a ransomware attack on July 18, 2023, resulting in costs of $202,274 for network security and credit monitoring, without paying a ransom. The City Council approved a funding request for more than $600,000 to cover unanticipated expenses for cybersecurity and special education, the latter of which increased due to a change in law in Connecticut. Insurance coverage was not available for some essential needs, and the district took steps to increase the security of its servers and information.
title: Danbury Schools Ask City Council for Help After Ransomware Attack

summary: The Ortivus electronic health records system is currently unavailable to some UK-based customers due to a cyber attack. So far, no patients have been directly affected and no other systems have been attacked. Only hosted data center customers were affected. Ortivus is working closely with affected customers to restore systems and recover data. The organization behind the cyberattack is not yet known and the incident has been reported to authorities as a crime.
title: Ortivus' electronic patient record system are down for some United Kingdom based customers due to a cyber-attack

summary: The Estée Lauder Companies Inc. has identified a cyberattack, where an unauthorized third party gained access to some of its systems. Following discovery of the incident, the company disabled some of its systems and began an investigation with the help of cybersecurity experts. The Company believes that the unauthorized third party obtained certain data from its systems and is working to understand the nature and extent of this data. The incident has caused and is expected to continue to cause disruption to some of the company's business operations. The company is implementing measures to secure its business operations and will continue to take additional measures as necessary.
title: The Estée Lauder Companies Inc. Provides Information on Cybersecurity Incident - The Estée Lauder Companies Inc.

summary: The Body Shop Japan's system suffered a ransomware cyberattack on July 18, causing delivery delays and other service impacts. No evidence has been found that any data was transferred outside of the company's system, but the incident is still being investigated with the help of external experts. The incident only concerns The Body Shop Japan and potentially affected data includes personal information of employees (including former employees) and some customer data of the official online store.
title: Notice regarding unauthorized access to our system and the impact on our service provision: | THE BODY SHOP

summary: The TOMRA company was the target of a major cyberattack directly affecting some of its data systems. The relevant authorities have been informed and all internal and external resources have been mobilized to contain and neutralize the incident. The attack was discovered on the morning of July 16 and immediate actions were taken to stop it and mitigate the consequences. TOMRA is currently evaluating whether its customers and employees could experience a reduction in the stability of its services. The company's main goal is to get all systems back up and running as quickly as possible.
title: TOMRA subject to cyberattack

summary: The laboratory company Helix suffered a cyberattack on the night of July 15-16, causing delays in the delivery of analysis results, but no leak of personal data was reported. The hackers attempted to plant “ransomware,” malware that encrypts files and crashes the system, then demanding a ransom for decrypting the data. The Helix IT team managed to stop the spread of the ransomware, leaving only part of the data encrypted. To prevent future leaks, the company has taken several steps, including resetting all customer passwords. The company continues to investigate
title: Helix warned of a delay in issuing test results due to a hacker attack

summary: George County, Mississippi's official computer systems were the target of a ransomware cyberattack, described by county officials as a "brute force attack from all sides." The attack, which began on Saturday, successfully penetrated systems on Sunday evening, following a highly professional phishing email that was likely clicked by a county employee. The hacker's identity is unknown, but he is willing to hold the county's entire computer system hostage in exchange for a Bitcoin ransom. The county backed up its computer system and database on Friday evening,
title: Official George County, Miss. computer systems hacked for ransom | WKRG

summary: HealthEC LLC, a healthcare technology company, advised of suspicious activity on its network between July 14 and 23, 2023, where sensitive customer data was potentially compromised, including personal and medical information. The company began notifying affected partners and individuals after completing an investigation on October 24, 2023. They recommend individuals monitor their accounts for suspicious activity and offer guidance on identity protection, including the use of free credit reports, fraud alerts and credit freezes.
title: HealthEC | KLAS-recognized Population Health Management Company

summary: Uppsala University was the target of a cyberattack suspected of being of Russian origin. The attack was made possible by the hijacking of a user account of one of the university employees. Discovered on July 14 by the security department, the incident was reported to the police. The university is currently investigating what type of data was stolen, primarily information from the IT department. Full names and usernames were also leaked in this leak, but the total number of people affected remains unclear.
title: Suspected Russian IT attack against Uppsala University: "May increase vulnerability" | SVT News

summary: Morehead State University was hit by a cyberattack affecting a limited number of computers on campus. President Jay Morgan said the university's internet, websites and servers would be kept offline to limit potential damage. University IT staff are working diligently with vendors to resolve the issue. Students are encouraged to disconnect campus computers from all networks while staff systematically resolve technical issues. No personal data has been compromised at this stage.
title: Morehead State University hit by cyber-attack

victim: Association des Employeurs de la Santé de Colombie-Britannique (HEABC)
summary: The Health Employers Association of British Columbia (HEABC) is facing a cybersecurity attack on one of its servers. This server hosts health services websites managed by HEABC, but the incident does not affect medical records. Users' personal information has potentially been compromised. HEABC is working with experts to resolve the incident, increase security and notify those affected. After discovering the attack in July, HEABC took steps to secure affected services and investigate the incident. The incident is limited to application forms and other specific information on the affected websites. The exact number of people affected has not yet been determined.
title: HEABC announces measures underway following a cyber security attack and potential data breach

summary: The Singapore Medical Academy was the victim of a ransomware cyberattack in July, leading to the leak of personal data of some members. The information disclosed includes names, addresses, emails, telephone numbers, identification or passport numbers, dates of birth, as well as credit card and bank account information. The Academy immediately reported the incident to the police and the Singapore Cyber ​​Security Agency, and took steps to strengthen its IT security. Approximately 50 doctors associated with the Academy have had their personal information published on the
title: Singapore Medical College was attacked by cyberattack and members' personal information was leaked - Local - Lion City News

summary: Navvis & Company, a healthcare facility service provider, suffered a cyberattack between July 12 and 25, 2023, resulting in the leak of sensitive SSM Health patient data, including names, social security numbers, and medical information. SSM Health, which was not directly impacted by the breach, notified affected patients through notification letters sent on December 29, 2023. Navvis launched an investigation with cybersecurity experts to determine the extent of the breach. breach and the specific information that was compromised.
title: SSM Health Confirms Patient Data Was Leaked Due to Third-Party Data Breach at Navvis & Company | Console and Associates, P.C. - JDSupra

summary: On July 12, 2023, the municipality of Ferrara in Italy suffered a cyberattack which resulted in the deactivation of its internal digital services for security reasons. As a result, counter services and telephone lines, including the helpline, are unavailable until further notice. Technical staff and the system support company are currently checking the digital infrastructure. An announcement will be made as soon as services are restored. In the meantime, the public information office remains open for citizens, and access to the institutional site and the functionalities of the multifunctional telematics counter is still available.
title: Municipality of Ferrara | Municipal Building Hacker Attack on the Municipality's Internet Network

summary: A cyber attack has been detected on the IT platform of 12 Norwegian ministries by the Departments’ Security and Service Organisation. The attack exploited an unknown vulnerability in a vendor’s software, which has since been patched. The incident is currently under investigation by the police and the Data Protection Authority has been informed. The immediate consequences of the attack are that employees are unable to synchronise their emails on their mobile phones. It is still too early to determine who is behind the attack and how widespread it is.
title: Ministries exposed to computer attacks: - Vulnerability in software has been exploited - Digi.no

summary: ZooTampa, a zoo located in Florida, recently discovered a cyberattack targeting its computer network. Following this discovery, the zoo immediately took proactive security measures to mitigate the impact of the incident. ZooTampa also brought in computer forensic specialists to secure the network and investigate the extent of the unauthorized activity. The zoo is also working with federal law enforcement to investigate the attack. Although details of the incident remain unclear, the zoo has proactively informed its employees and vendors whose personal information may have been impacted, and has offered services
title: ZooTampa hit by cyber attack, target unclear | WFLA

summary: The City of Cornelius neutralized a potential cyber threat on the evening of July 11, 2023. Ransomware was detected on a City device, and action was taken to contain the threat. Work is underway to clean affected devices before fully restoring city operations. Some services may be temporarily unavailable.
title: Town Addresses Cyber Threat

victim: Tribunal de Contas do Estado do Rio de Janeiro (TCE-RJ)
summary: The website of the Tribunal de Contas do Estado do Rio de Janeiro (TCE-RJ) was the victim of a cyberattack, making it inaccessible. A court employee is suspected of causing the incident in response to allegations of contract fraud within the organization. The TCE-RJ Information Technology team is currently working to resolve the issue, but there is no specific timeline yet for systems to be normalized. A Crisis Management Committee has been set up to manage the situation. As a result of the incident, the court suspended the counting of procedural deadlines until July 14 to avoid any prejudice.
title: After cyber attack, TCE-RJ team works to normalize systems | Security Report

summary: The Province of Namur in Belgium was the target of a cyberattack. Five of its servers have been hit by hackers. A ransom was demanded by the cybercriminals. The director general of the Province of Namur, Valéry Zuinen, confirmed the incident. This event comes a few weeks after the two sites of the Sainte-Marie Regional Hospital Center (CHRSM) also suffered a computer attack.
title: The Province of Namur victim of a hacker: “Five of our servers were affected, a ransom was demanded”, explains the general director

summary: The Australian Academy of Education and Careers was hit by a #cyberattack, discovered on the night of July 11-12. The LockBit ransomware group added the institute to its victim list on July 18.

summary: Risas Dental & Braces in Phoenix, AZ, recently informed patients of a cyberattack detected in July 2023 in which their protected health information was exposed. Unusual activities were identified in its computer systems on July 10, 2023, and immediate measures were taken to secure its network. External cybersecurity specialists were engaged to investigate the incident and determine the nature and extent of the unauthorized activity.
title: MFA Bypassed in Cyberattack on L.A. County Department of Mental Health

summary: The Municipality of Kings County announced that a cyberattack in July likely affected people's personal information, including the names and email addresses of those who corresponded with the municipality. Experts believe the initial intrusion took place on July 10 by exploiting a software vulnerability on one of the municipality's servers. title: Cyber attack raises concerns about personal data access - Richmond News

title: Cybersecurity Notice | Tampa General Hospital
