The DBSA has taken steps to investigate the incident, restore its information systems and prevent future attacks. Stakeholders are encouraged to remain vigilant and report any incorrect use of their personal information.
title: Notification of Security Compromise | Development Bank of Southern Africa

summary: A company specializing in business charter flights is facing a hacker attack that could have devastating consequences. Upon request, the company confirms Watson's matching searches. On May 21, the Intrusion Detection System (IDS) detected an attempted unauthorized access to the network. Subsequently, some computer systems were affected by a ransomware attack, i.e. encryption.
title: Black Basta attacks well-known Swiss aviation company – cyber attack raises questions

summary: The city of Augusta was the victim of a cyberattack. The city's computers are out of service. Sensitive taxpayer information could be exposed. The impact of the attack is currently being investigated. The Atlanta FBI is assisting in the investigation.
title: Mayor Johnson confirms cyber attack on Augusta computer systems | WJBF

summary: Thomas Hardye School in Dorchester was the victim of a cyberattack on May 21. The school's computer system was hacked and is still down. Exams are not affected and the school remains open. Online payments, files and messaging are inaccessible. The ransom demand was refused and the incident was reported to the National Cyber ​​Security Center and the police.
title: Thomas Hardye School in Dorchester hit by cyber attack | Dorset Echo

summary: Email hosting provider United Hoster was the victim of a ransomware attack exploiting a Microsoft Exchange security flaw. The servers were encrypted, but no data was stolen according to the company. Customers were informed and an alternative messaging solution was offered. United Hoster is currently rebuilding new Exchange infrastructure to migrate customers. The number of affected customers has not been disclosed.
title: Ransomware attack: Hosted Exchange from United Hoster offline | heise online

summary: Taylor University was the victim of a ransomware cyberattack on May 18, 2023, discovered on November 16, 2023, affecting the personal and financial data of individuals, including 37 Maine residents. Written notification to consumers occurred on December 4, 2023, and the university offered 12 months of credit monitoring services through IDX. The legal entity responsible for the notification is represented by Colin Battersby of McDonald Hopkins.
title: Office of the Maine AG: Consumer Protection: Privacy, Identity Theft and Data Security Breaches

summary: The Columbus Regional Healthcare System hospital in North Carolina was the victim of a ransomware attack by the Daixin group. The latter encrypted the hospital's servers after exfiltrating data and deleting backups. Negotiations with the hackers failed and they announced that they would publish more than 250,000 files containing sensitive data. The attack was facilitated by the numerous critical and high-risk vulnerabilities detected during a security assessment in March. The hackers also claimed that the hospital did not have a network anomaly monitoring system.
title: Another hospital hit by ransomware: Columbus Regional Healthcare System in North Carolina hit by Daixin

summary: The Cangas town hall was the victim of a cyberattack which affected the management and payment of salaries. A virus was introduced into the system via a fake email. The computers were encrypted and a ransom demanded. The town hall managed to stop the theft of information and recover 70% of the data. The LockBit cybercriminal group is suspected of being behind the attack.
title: A false email to an official made it possible to start the cyber attack on the City Council of Cangas - Time News

summary: The company Bloomfleet, specializing in fleet management, suffered a cyberattack on May 18, 2023. Security systems immediately blocked access to the platform and isolated the affected areas. The company has launched an internal investigation to identify the causes of the incident and take additional security measures. Restoration work is underway and the company apologizes for the inconvenience caused. IT security remains crucial for businesses handling sensitive data.
title: Bloomfleet Warns of Cybersecurity Incident: 'We're Investigating Further'

summary: The ATU garage chain was the victim of a cyberattack on May 18. Since then, their website has been inaccessible and phone calls are not working. The group confirmed the attack. The details of the attack are not specified. The consequences of the attack are also not specified.
title: Workshop chain ATU falls victim to cyber attack | Automobilwoche.de

summary: The websites of the "Südwest Presse" and the "Heidenheimer Zeitung" have been inaccessible since Thursday. The “Heidenheimer Zeitung” reports a cyberattack affecting its host. In both cases, the host is Mivitec GmH.
title: Cyber ​​attack on "Heidenheimer Zeitung" and "Südwest Presse"? - SWR Aktuell

summary: The Reeds Spring School District was the victim of a sophisticated cyberattack, resulting in unauthorized access and acquisition of personal and district data. Potentially compromised information includes full names, addresses, medical information, health insurance information, driver's license or government ID card numbers, Social Security numbers, and educational information. The district has set up a hotline to help those potentially affected and is offering credit monitoring.
title: MO: ‘Cyber attack’ hits Reeds Spring schools. Data breach includes Social Security numbers

summary: NOSM University was the victim of a cyberattack which was discovered on Wednesday. Many networks and IT services are still inaccessible. Employees and students have been asked to work remotely. The university has taken measures to secure the network and data. Experts were hired to help resolve the problem.
title: Cyber attack at NOSM U forces staff and students to stay home - Sudbury News

summary: The Downs School in Compton was the victim of a possible cyberattack, resulting in a week-long interruption of internet access. The headteacher praised the flexibility and courage of staff in ensuring the continuity of students' education. The Department for Education, West Berkshire Council, the ICO and Action Fraud were contacted to help restore the systems safely. Year 11 and Year 13 students have been given priority to access Teams and revision materials. The canteen's cash register system was also affected.
title: The Downs School, hit by possible cyber attack, seeking help from West Berkshire Council, the Department for Education and cyber security experts

summary: Franklin County Public Schools have been hit by a ransomware attack. Classes have been canceled for security reasons. Proactive measures were taken to limit the impact of the attack. Local and state authorities, including the FBI and Virginia State Police, are involved in the investigation. Ransomware attacks are becoming more common and often impact the healthcare, manufacturing, and government sectors.
title: Franklin County Public Schools hit by ransomware attack

summary: Adams Bank & Trust in western Nebraska has restricted access to its website and mobile app due to a suspected cyberattack. Servers were locked down to protect customer financial information. An investigation and forensic analysis was carried out to identify the source of the threat. The bank said there was no evidence that customer information had been accessed. Online services are still unavailable and the bank is working to restore the situation.
title: Western Nebraska bank locks down servers because of suspected cyberattack | National News | kpvi.com

summary: The Voyageurs du Monde group suffered a cyberattack on the night of May 15 to 16. A crisis unit has been set up to manage the situation. Internet access was cut off to allow analysis of the situation. The teams strengthened the security of the information system to avoid new incidents. No payment data is stored on the systems and no customer data has been stolen to date.
title: Voyageurs du Monde: Cyber ​​attack contained at Voyageurs du Monde | Zonebourse

summary: A hacker attack took place in Gorizia. Cross-border bike sharing has slowed down as a result. The attack took place on May 16, 2023. The article was updated at 9:41 p.m. Reading the article takes approximately 2 minutes.
title: Hacker attack in Gorizia, cross-border bike sharing slowed down - Il Piccolo

summary: The website and telephone services of the Territorial Collectivity of Martinique are inaccessible following a cyberattack. This attack paralyzes the functioning of the community. A crisis meeting is underway to restore the IT devices. This is not the first time that the CTM has suffered such an attack. Several regions in France have also been victims of hackers.
title: Cyberattack: CTM website inaccessible following computer hacking

summary: The City of Ogden Dunes believes it has been the victim of a cyberattack and is investigating to determine the extent of the threat. Residents are urged not to open emails from the city or other government officials, especially if they contain attachments. People needing to contact the town hall should call a specific number. No comment was made by city officials. Authorities hope to resolve the situation quickly.
title: Ogden Dunes believes it was hit by a cyber attack - Chesterton Tribune

summary: The regional cybersecurity conferences were held in Chartres to raise awareness among businesses and local authorities in the Center-Val de Loire of the risks of cyberattacks, with the creation of CyberRespond, an emergency center having handled 154 files in one year. The company Teamex suffered a major cyber attack that lasted three weeks, revealing that all sectors, even the least obvious, are susceptible to being targeted by cybercriminals.
title: Cyber ​​attacks, a new challenge for businesses and communities in the Centre-Val de Loire region - France Bleu

summary: Law firm Buckley King LPA has been the victim of a cyberattack by ransomware group BlackBasta. The group exfiltrated 110GB of sensitive data and demanded a $400,000 ransom to return it. After negotiations, the firm agreed to pay $150,000 to recover the data. Part of the ransom was transferred to another wallet. The firm has not yet made a public statement on the incident.
title: Cleveland, OH: cyberattack, law firm strikes deal with ransomware group BlackBasta for $150,000

victim: Oklahoma Institute of Allergy Asthma and Immunology
summary: An allergy and asthma institute has closed its doors due to an alleged security data breach. Patients are concerned about the possible compromise of their medical records. Patients were refused entry to the institute due to a sign indicating a security data breach. The FBI has not yet received a report of a cybersecurity breach. The institute's remaining employees work to distribute patients' medications to other providers.
title: Patients concerned after local allergy clinic closes its doors because of alleged data breach

summary: SMDEA was the victim of a large-scale cyberattack claimed by a ransomware criminal group. A complaint was filed and a disruption of administrative services was noted. The authorities call on users to be vigilant in the face of fraudulent contacts referring to the SMDEA. Personal and banking data could be affected. No ransom has been paid and a new update is expected in 15 days.
title: The SMDEA victim of a large-scale cyber attack: faced with data theft, users must be vigilant - La Gazette Ariégeoise

summary: ScanSource, a US-based technology services provider, was the victim of a ransomware attack that affected some of its systems, business operations and customer portals. The attack began on May 14, 2023 and caused delays in providing services to customers in North America and Brazil. The company has implemented its incident response plan and alerted the relevant authorities. Cybersecurity experts were called in to help minimize operational disruption caused by the incident. It is not yet known which ransomware operation is behind the attack or if any data was stolen.
title: ScanSource says ransomware attack behind multi-day outages

summary: The Philadelphia Inquirer newspaper was the victim of a cyberattack that disrupted its operations over the weekend. The newspaper was unable to print its Sunday edition, but was able to continue publishing online. The systems are not yet fully restored and there is no specific timeline at this time. The FBI has been informed of the incident. Cyber ​​attacks are a growing threat to news organizations and it is important to follow cybersecurity best practices.
title: Philadelphia Inquirer continues response to cyberattack that disrupted publication

summary: The websites of two transport companies in Chemnitz are not accessible this weekend. IT specialists are working on a solution to resolve the problem. Digital traces were secured and a police investigation was opened. It is suspected that a cyberattack was the cause of the outage. The Verkehrsverbund Mittelsachsen website is still accessible.
title: Possible cyberattack on Chemnitz public transport | Sächsische.de

summary: Florida medical device company Electrostim Medical Services, Inc. suffered a cyberattack in May 2023, exposing the protected health data of 542,990 patients. Suspicious activity was detected on May 13, 2023, and although no data theft was confirmed, the hackers had access to the network for approximately two weeks, being able to copy sensitive information. The company sent notification letters to affected patients in December and took steps to strengthen the security of its network.
title: Electrostim Medical Services Data Breach Impacts 543,000 Patients

summary: KD Hospital was hit by a ransomware attack, blocking access to all of its online systems, including patient data. The hackers demanded a ransom of $70,000 in bitcoins to decrypt the files. An investigation is underway to determine if there were any vulnerabilities in the hospital's IT infrastructure. Hospital staff worked manually for a day before the servers were back up and running. A complaint was filed with the police.
title: Hospital falls prey to ransomware attack, hackers demand $70,000 | Ahmedabad News, The Indian Express

summary: The outsourcer Group DIS reports a major computer attack. Many customers' websites (or even their end customers) are unavailable. Some report a database connection error. Others just display a blank page. Attack claimed by Alphv/BlackCat on May 15. Lacroix Electronics, the Côtes-d’Armor department, and Actu.fr are among the collateral victims.
title: Lacroix Electronics: collateral victim of the cyberattack against Group DIS | LeMagIT

victim: Le groupe hospitalier "Gesundheit Nord" à Brême
summary: The computer network of the "Gesundheit Nord" hospital group in Bremen was disconnected from the Internet after suspicious activities were discovered. Hospitals can still communicate with each other, but employees cannot access the Internet. The patients are not in danger. The reasons for the disconnection are still unknown, but a computer attack cannot be ruled out. Investigations are underway. This situation is similar to other recent computer attacks in the healthcare sector.
title: Suspected cyber attack: Bremen hospitals without internet since Wednesday | heise online

summary: The Macon-Bibb County network in Georgia has been taken offline after a possible cyberattack, and additional security measures are being put in place to investigate the potential breach. Civil servants cannot currently access their emails or landlines. The county requested assistance from state and federal security authorities to resolve the incident.
title: Georgia county's network taken down after potential cyberattack | 13wmaz.com

summary: Two hosting servers were encrypted on May 12, 2023 in a superficial, most likely automated, cyberattack. Both hosting servers run an old contract management system, which is used on a limited basis and for a small portion of contracts.
title: Limited cyber attack against visumPOINT GmbH

summary: The Vitrey group, a construction company based in Haute-Marne, was the victim of a large-scale cyberattack last May. All the group's subsidiaries were impacted. The financial damage is very significant, but no ransom has been paid. The Chaumont public prosecutor's office relinquished responsibility in favor of the Paris public prosecutor's office for the investigation. State services are organizing a conference to raise awareness among local stakeholders of the fragility of their IT equipment.
title: jhm | The Vitrey group victim of a large-scale cyberattack

summary: Japanese railway company JR East was the victim of a cyberattack which temporarily disrupted its Mobile Suica application and its online reservation system Eki-net. The incident began around 5:30 p.m. and was resolved more than four hours later, without affecting train operations. Users experienced difficulties accessing services, but public transport cards could still be used if they had a remaining balance.
title: JR East briefly hit by system disruption due to cyberattack

summary: The Red Bus company suffered a cyberattack that prevented users from recharging their urban transport card in Córdoba, Argentina. Although most charging points still have credit available, some are closed and display "no balance". Users can use their card for up to four trips with a negative balance, but will need to clear the balance once the system is back up and running. The Municipality of Córdoba has authorized two additional trips with a negative balance. Red Bus estimates that the system will be restored in the coming hours.
title: Red Bus Card: what happens if I can't recharge it to travel due to the cyber attack

summary: Richmond University Medical Center suffered a ransomware attack that resulted in a network outage. The extent of the violation is unclear. Staff must manually enter data and monitor patients individually. The medical center is working with third-party cybersecurity experts to investigate the incident. It is still unknown whether any patient information was compromised.
title: Richmond University Medical Center suffers ransomware attack; unclear if patient info compromised - silive.com

summary: On May 11, 2023, Braintree became aware of suspicious activity in its network environment. Upon discovery, Braintree immediately engaged a law firm specializing in cybersecurity and data privacy to conduct a further investigation. In addition, Braintree has brought in forensic specialists to help analyze any unauthorized activity. Although the investigation is ongoing, Braintree has determined that an unauthorized third party accessed files containing personal information of certain individuals during this incident.
title: Notice of data breach

summary: Suzuki Motorcycle's factory in India was closed for a week due to a cyber attack. Production has been halted since May 10, resulting in a loss of production of more than 20,000 vehicles. Suzuki Motorcycle has informed its suppliers that it has postponed its annual conference due to an “unprecedented business requirement”. The attack is currently under investigation and the government has been informed. India is Suzuki Motorcycle's largest market outside of Japan and accounts for 50% of its global production.
title: Suzuki Motorcycle India plant shut for a week due to cyber-attack | Autocar Professional

summary: The University of Zaragoza has suffered an attempted cyberattack via VPN. It is believed to be a lockbit ransomware. No major consequences have been detected at this time. Personal computers have been advised to be turned off this weekend to minimize the risks. The University has cut off access to compromised accounts and has strengthened its backup system.
title: The University of Zaragoza suffers a cyber attack that has not caused any significant damage

summary: Seacom, an internet services company, was the victim of a cyberattack. Some of its customers were impacted without being warned. The incident was contained to a small server environment and did not affect the main network. No customer data was compromised. Seacom has implemented a business continuity plan to restore its systems.
title: Seacom hit by cyber attack

summary: Australian company TechnologyOne suffered a cyberattack that gave an unauthorized third party access to its back-office systems. The company has isolated the affected systems and is investigating the incident. The company's SaaS platform was not affected. The company did not disclose the potential impact on its revenue. Other major Australian companies have also reported data breaches and unauthorized access.
title: ERP firm TechnologyOne faces cyber attack - InfotechLead

summary: Chattanooga State has been hit by a cyberattack that has shut down many campus services. Classes have been canceled through May 26 and credits have been delayed. Details of the attack have not been released, but the school is working with law enforcement and cyber forensics experts to investigate the incident. Students and staff have been urged to remain vigilant and follow best practices to protect their personal information. Events scheduled for campus have been canceled and there is no date for a return to normal at this time. Cyberattack claimed by Snatch on May 23, 2023.
title: Chatt State Suffering from Cyber Attack - WDEF

summary: Norton Healthcare suffered a cyberattack on May 9, which resulted in its systems being taken offline to protect its network. Norton's information services team and law enforcement were immediately notified of the incident after receiving a suspicious message related to its information systems. All desktop emails have been restored to Norton facilities. The Norton team is working to resolve the issue and provide answers to those who may be affected. Norton asked for the community's patience as it works to restore full network operations.
title: Norton Healthcare working to restore network after cyber attack

summary: The computer system of three departments of Tulancingo City Hall was the victim of a ransomware attack. The hackers demanded a ransom in bitcoins to restore the data. The affected departments are Land Tax, Land Registry and Property Transfer and Tax Execution. The town hall refused to pay the ransom and took steps to recover the data. Taxpayer data is protected and the town hall has reported the incident to the competent authorities.
title: Tulancingo mayor's office suffers cyber attack

summary: Indonesia's largest Islamic bank, BSI, has been hit by a ransomware attack. Hacker group LockBit claimed responsibility for the attack and demanded a $20 million ransom. BSI refused to pay the ransom and the hackers published the data of 15 million customers and employees of the bank. BSI assured that its customers' data was secure and that it was working with authorities to resolve the issue. The attack raises questions about BSI's preparedness and vulnerability to cyber threats, as well as the need for better cybersecurity awareness and regulation in
title: Explained: The ransomware attack on BSI, Indonesia's largest Islamic bank | Coconuts

summary: A group of cybercriminals attempted to blackmail Dragos, but failed to compromise their systems. Criminals managed to gain access to resources used by a new sales employee by compromising his personal email address. Dragos blocked the compromised account and activated its incident response plan. The criminals attempted to deploy ransomware and contacted Dragos employees, but the company chose not to negotiate with them. Dragos added additional security measures and recommends strengthening identity and access management infrastructure and processes.
title: Deconstructing a Cybersecurity Event | Dragos

summary: The Superior Labor Court suffered a cyberattack which paralyzed its digital systems. The duration of the attack and the potentially compromised data are not yet known. Cybersecurity experts recommend adopting robust digital security practices and training employees to identify threats. It is crucial that government and private organizations work together to protect citizens' information and privacy. This attack highlights the importance of investing in digital security and taking preventative measures to avoid future incidents.
title: Cyber ​​attack paralyzes Superior Labor Court systems

summary: The Fleury group suffered a computer attack on Sunday night. The company immediately activated its security protocols to minimize impacts to its operations. Specialist companies were called in to help resolve the problem. Operations are gradually resuming with security tests underway. Fleury continues to investigate the circumstances of the attack and is taking all necessary measures to limit the damage caused.
title: Fleury (FLRY3) identifies cyber attack on its system on Sunday night - São Bento in Focus - São Bento, Paraíba, Brazil and the World

summary: The Phoenician Medical Center (PMC) recently reported a cyberattack that disrupted some of its IT systems, potentially affecting up to 162,500 current and former patients. Compromised information includes names, contact information, demographic information, dates of birth, state identification numbers, medical record numbers, diagnostic and treatment information, provider names, dates of service, prescription information and /or health insurance information. The incident was reported to the HHS Office for Civil Rights.
title: Phoenician Medical Center Cyberattack Affects Up to 162,500 Patients

summary: In May, the Coteau town hall suffered a cyberattack which paralyzed almost all of its networks, causing disruptions for a week and requiring two months to return to normal. This attack cost the municipality around 43,000 euros and had repercussions on municipal services, including the postponement of a municipal council. The origin of the attack and the identification of the perpetrators remain unknown, the hackers being untraceable.
title: In Le Coteau, the cyberattack cost the town hall 43,000 euros - Le Coteau (42120)

summary: Swiss company ABB, specializing in electrification and automation technologies, was the victim of a Black Basta ransomware attack, which affected its Windows Active Directory and hundreds of devices. The attack led to project delays and disruptions at factories. ABB has terminated VPN connections with its customers to prevent the spread of ransomware to other networks. Black Basta is a cybercrime group that launched its Ransomware-as-a-Service operation in April 2022 and quickly began amassing corporate victims in double extortion attacks. Researchers also linked the ransomware group to the hacker gang
title: Multinational tech firm ABB hit by Black Basta ransomware attack

summary: The IT supplier of the energy company HVC was the victim of a cyberattack. Customer data was affected, leading to connection and billing issues. The issue has been resolved, but customers are still unable to access their personal portal. HVC informed customers of the incident and apologized, but says customer data was likely not compromised. The company did not pay a ransom to the cybercriminals.
title: IT supplier of energy company HVC hit by cyber attack

summary: AISI, a cybersecurity company, has been helping an SME/ETI victim of a ransomware attack since last Sunday. The victim company is an IDF structure with 300-500 employees. As soon as the attack was reported, AISI contacted the customer within 10 minutes. AISI teams created a War Room and collected logs from all VMs, thus starting an investigation to identify the strain/group of attackers and transfer the data to be restored to the specialized recovery team. During the following two days, AISI continued the investigation, accompanied the client in the reconstruction and supervised in real time. However, there were several problems that needed to be faced. For example, the client was unable to turn off the internet because the management did not want it, and it was difficult to transfer all the data from its host to the catering team, which resulted in a loss of more than 48 hours . In addition, there were commercial requests with very different costs and offers which were often of little relevance. The client was placed under SOC on Monday to limit risks with detailed monitoring of attackers' IOCs/IOAs and the deployment of SentinelOne.
title: How AISI is helping a company hit by ransomware since last Sunday

summary: Palomar Health Medical Group was the victim of a potential cyberattack, resulting in delays for patients and disruptions to operations. Telephones, fax machines and the online portal are currently out of service, and patients may experience delays. The organization hired external experts to investigate the incident and determine the scale of the cyberattack.
title: Palomar Health Medical Group hit by potential cyberattack - The San Diego Union-Tribune

summary: A cyberattack hit the Raleigh, North Carolina Housing Authority. Computer systems were shut down, affecting business operations and residents. The National Guard was called in to investigate the attack. The Housing Authority has notified state and federal authorities and is working to identify the perpetrators of the attack. Residents can still submit their maintenance needs via a call line.
title: Raleigh Housing Authority cyber-attack | Cyberattack shuts down Raleigh Housing Authority computer systems - ABC11 Raleigh-Durham

summary: The German company Maxim, specializing in the production of cosmetics, was the victim of a cyberattack. Cybercriminals managed to paralyze the company's IT systems. Details of the attack have not been released. The company said it was working with security experts to resolve the issue.
title: Private label manufacturer: Cyber ​​blackmailers paralyze Maxim

summary: Hackers have published sensitive data stolen from AvidXchange, a payments software company, following a second ransomware attack this year. The stolen data includes nondisclosure agreements, employee payroll information and company bank account numbers. Login data was also leaked, including usernames, passwords and answers to security questions for various company systems. Easily guessable passwords suggest the company uses lax security practices. AvidXchange confirmed that data was exfiltrated in April but declined to answer TechCrunch's questions regarding a possible ransom demand.
title: Payment software giant AvidXchange suffers its second ransomware attack of 2023

victim: Le bureau du superviseur des élections du comté de Hillsborough
summary: According to this article, a cyberattack took place at the Hillsborough County Supervisor of Elections office. Access to the article's website has been blocked for users. The cause of the attack was not specified. The elections office said voter information was not compromised. The investigation is ongoing.
title: Access Denied

summary: The SECOP II platform, used for public contracting frameworks in Colombia, was the victim of a cyberattack. The platform was out of service for 34 hours. User data was not compromised. Ongoing processes will not be affected. State security agencies have been summoned to investigate the incident.
title: Cyber ​​attack on the SECOP II platform confirmed - Infobae

summary: About 24,000 patients at Mount Desert Island Hospital received a letter informing them of an IT security breach. The IT department quickly detected the intrusion and closed the attack within half an hour.
title: Cyber attack compromises hospital data

summary: Part of the Dallas police communications system went down, along with some other city services. It is not yet known whether the outage was due to a malfunction or a cyberattack. The outage affects the police assistance system, called CAD, which directs officers to emergencies and other calls. 911 operators can receive calls, but they must manually write down instructions for police officers. Officers can only respond by phone and radio.
title: Possible cyber attack hampering Dallas police operations - CBS Texas

summary: Avezzano Sulmona L'Aquila (ASL 1) has suffered a cyber attack that has blocked the servers. Patients can no longer make appointments and are sent home. Hospitals are also affected, with difficulties in issuing test results and registering blood donors. The situation is being managed manually. The cyber attack was claimed by the Monti group.
title: Inconvenience to the ASL 1 Avezzano Sulmona L'Aquila due to the blocking of the servers - Rete8

summary: A public school in Asheville has been closed due to a cyberattack. Telephones and internet did not work. The school was notified of the attack by the North Carolina Department of Public Instruction. It may take several days to resolve the issue. The Advanced Literature and Composition exam will take place as scheduled.
title: Cyberattack closes public charter school in Asheville | WLOS

summary: The company was the victim of a ransomware cyberattack. The investigation showed that the attackers exploited a known vulnerability in the VPN firewall. Much of the company's systems, including servers, were encrypted by the ransomware. Regarding the system restoration, given the impossibility of completely recovering the current systems, the company decided to continue the transition to a new system which was already planned for April 2024. In the meantime, an interim way to Data entry will be implemented to enable continued use of the operational accounting system.
title: [Status Report] About the results of the investigation of ransomware damage

summary: A computer network at Perry Johnson & Associates, a provider of medical transcription services for Northwell Health, was compromised by an unauthorized party, resulting in the potential copying of sensitive patient data, including medical records and insurance information. The security incident took place between March 27 and May 2, 2023, and the affected data includes names, social security numbers, and diagnostic test results, among other personal information.
title: Data breach of network with Northwell Health patient info - Newsday

summary: A cyberattack has hit the university, with an intrusion dating back to May 2023, where an unauthorized third party accessed the Microsoft Office system, email accounts and SharePoint files. Police are investigating this security breach. Students and staff of the university are affected by this attack.
title: University staff, students caught in cyber attack | The Canberra Times | Canberra, ACT

summary: Mission Community Hospital in California began notifying its patients about a cyberattack that occurred in May 2023, in which protected health and personal information was exposed, including names, addresses, social security numbers and financial informations. An investigation revealed that the unauthorized access to the hospital network took place on the same day that files containing patient data were accessed, and affected individuals were offered a year of credit monitoring service and protection against identity theft. Ransomware group RansomHouse claimed responsibility for the attack, claiming to have infiltrated more than 2
title: Mission Community Hospital Alerts Patients About May 2023 Cyberattack

summary: Mortgage broker Cafpi was the victim of a cyberattack by the Vice Society group at the end of April. Personal data and internal information were stolen. Crisis management was immediately triggered and a complaint was filed with the CNIL. Cafpi did not have network traces to determine the extent of the attack. Cafpi's priority is now to inform its customers.
title: Ransomware: CAFPI was attacked at the end of April by Vice Society | LeMagIT

summary: Students at Wichita State University were affected by an internet outage. Some students expressed increased anxiety due to this outage. The extent of the outage is not specified in the article. The article does not mention the cause of the failure. The article was published on the KAKE website.
title: Internet outage compromising WSU students - KAKE

summary: Over the weekend, the PENNCREST School District became aware of a situation, believed to be ransomware, that disrupted some aspects of our operations. We quickly took steps to implement our cybersecurity incident response plan. In accordance with this plan, we have shut down and disconnected the entire network and technology infrastructure. We are currently working with external cybersecurity specialists to conduct a thorough investigation into the nature and scope of the event and to safely restore operations. The name of the Word file used to produce the PDF file containing the press release suggests a cyberattack involving Royal ransomware.
title: Ransomware Event

summary: Bluefield University was the victim of a cyberattack that caused the school's computer systems to shut down. Exams and assignments were postponed in response to the attack. Students and staff have been warned not to log into university accounts, including emails, to avoid intrusion. The security breach began in the university's email system. There is no specific time frame for resolving the issue. Updates will be posted on the university's social media channels.
title: Cyber attack at Bluefield University leads to postponed finals

summary: The Nashua School District was the victim of a sophisticated cyberattack. Classes were still in session the next day. An investigation is underway to determine the nature and scope of the attack. Personal data of students, parents and staff may have been compromised. Authorities are working to restore systems to functionality as quickly as possible.
title: Nashua School District hit by 'sophisticated' cyberattack

summary: Mission Community Hospital in California was the victim of a cyberattack in April. The attackers, known as RansomHouse, exploited vulnerabilities in Paragon and Cisco systems. VMware files stored in the virtual storage network have been encrypted. The attackers also exfiltrated patient data. Hospital staff are confident they have ejected the attackers.
title: Mission Community Hospital attackers exploited vulnerabilites in Paragon and Cisco

summary: Hawa Sliding Solutions AG, a Swiss manufacturer of sliding door fittings, was the victim of a cyberattack at the end of April 2023. The company responded immediately by informing its customers and suppliers, shutting down all its systems and asking most of its employees to work from home. An internal team and specialists are currently working on the complete restoration of operational processes. Orders can currently only be processed manually and IT systems are being rebuilt. victim: Le département de l'éducation de Bâle
summary: Hackers managed to break into the computer system of the education department in Basel, Switzerland, to steal around 1.2 terabytes of data. The hackers tried to extort money in exchange for the return of the data, but the department did not give in to their demand. The stolen data includes personal information about students and teachers, assessment reports and report cards. The hackers were identified as part of a group called "Bianlian", which has already attacked more than 100 companies and institutions around the world. The education department filed a complaint with the prosecutor against
title: Major cyber attack - children affected: data from the Basel Department of Education hacked - News - SRF

summary: Email accounts belonging to members of the SPD executive committee were hacked. Hackers exploited a security hole in an Exchange server and stole data. The attack trail leads to Russia. German authorities have been informed and potentially affected people have been warned. The SPD said there was strong evidence that the attackers were Russian.
title: Cyber ​​attack on email accounts of the SPD party executive

summary: PurFoods, a home meal delivery service in the United States, revealed a data breach affecting more than 1.2 million people. According to a report, hackers may have accessed customers' personal, financial and medical information, including names, financial account and payment card numbers, Social Security numbers and membership identification numbers. 'Health Insurance. The incident took place in January but was not discovered until February. PurFoods provided one year of free access to credit monitoring services for individuals whose personal information was potentially affected.
title: US food delivery service PurFoods discloses data breach

summary: The Des Moines school district was the victim of a cyberattack in January 2023. Nearly 6,700 people were notified of the incident and the possible exposure of their personal data. Security measures have been taken to prevent future similar attacks. Those potentially affected were offered free credit monitoring services. No evidence of financial fraud or identity theft has been found at this time.
title: DMPS Notifies Individuals of Data Security Incident - Des Moines Public Schools

summary: The World Council of Churches (WCC) was the victim of a ransomware cyberattack on December 26, causing all of its systems to be taken down. The general secretary of the WCC, Rev. Prof. Dr Jerry Pillay, strongly condemned the attack and asserted that the organization would not give in to threats, while emphasizing the need for a strong voice for digital justice. The WCC has informed the Swiss police and is taking measures to strengthen its security, while calling for vigilance in the face of possible hoaxes spread by pirates.
title: WCC news: WCC hit by ransomware attack

summary: Anna Jaques Hospital suffered a serious cyber incident which compromised its IT systems, leading to delays in services and the diversion of ambulances to other hospitals on Christmas Day. Hospital administrators secured the environment and hired cybersecurity professionals for the investigation, but did not provide details about the nature or target of the attack. Ambulance service resumed Dec. 26 and the hospital is working in collaboration with other facilities in the Beth Israel Lahey Health System.
title: Anna Jaques systems compromised after cyber issue | Local News | newburyportnews.com

summary: The Maschinenring Freising was the victim of a cyberattack, but has now recovered. The members are satisfied, but there has also been criticism from those in charge. The computer system was paralyzed for a month, but most of the data was recovered. The cost of the attack amounts to around 40,000 euros. The Maschinenring currently has 1670 members satisfied with its services.
title: Freising: After hacker attacks: Maschinenring Freising has recovered - “Fire brigade for farmers”

summary: Housing association Connexus has confirmed a cyberattack involving unauthorized access to its systems, according to a post on their Facebook page on December 18. In response, Connexus has taken its systems offline to protect users' personal data and is working with relevant IT teams and agencies to investigate and restore the systems. The company advised its customers to remain vigilant, particularly regarding financial information, and announced that its telephone lines were back operational.
title: Housing association confirms cyber attack - BBC News

summary: The 70-year-old Cheyenne Radiology Group & MRI recently suffered a cyberattack that may have resulted in the inadvertent exposure of patient personal information. While there is no evidence of misuse of sensitive information, the group took steps to notify the community of the incident. After detecting the security breach on December 12, the group hired a specialized forensic expert to determine whether patient information had been affected. Customers have been sent letters with additional details about the incident and offering credit monitoring services to those affected.
title: 70-year-old radiology practice suffers cyberattack

summary: Prophete, a bicycle manufacturer, was the victim of a cyberattack on November 25, 2022, which paralyzed its production, invoicing and deliveries for approximately three weeks, contributing to its bankruptcy. The attack was immediately reported to the Landeskriminalamt (German regional criminal police) and the data protection authority, but details of the incident are being withheld due to ongoing investigations. In addition to the ransomware attack, the company has also suffered from supply issues and high storage costs, and the future of its brands is uncertain, with a process
title: Bicycle manufacturer Prophete: First details about the cyber attack | heise online

summary: A 'cyber incident' has affected around 80 businesses in the UK, disrupting property transactions and preventing access to systems. Specialist legal sector infrastructure service provider CTS is working with cyber forensic experts to resolve the issue and restore systems as quickly as possible. Although there is no evidence of data integrity compromise, systems will not be brought back online until there is complete assurance of their security.
title: 'Cyber incident' impacting transactions - c. 80 firms affected | Today's Conveyancer

summary: New York healthcare provider Northeast Orthopedics and Sports Medicine was the victim of a cyberattack that compromised the personal data of more than 177,000 people, including patients, revealing sensitive information such as Social Security numbers, driver's license information, and medical details. The company detected the suspicious activity on November 22 and confirmed the unauthorized access on December 29, but did not make the statement public until February 9, offering credit monitoring and identity protection services to the victims.
title: Northeast Orthopedics suffers data breach​ | Cybernews

summary: Direct debit company London & Zurich was the victim of a ransomware attack on November 10, leading to significant service interruptions and payment delays for its customers, with some having to resort to loans to alleviate cash flow problems. The company's communication has been criticized for its lack of clarity and frequency, leaving customers uncertain about when services will resume normally. Despite the incident, London & Zurich has begun rebuilding its servers in a new environment and plans to fully restore its services by the end of the week, while continuing to investigate the attack.
title: London & Zurich ransomware attack causes customer chaos • The Register

summary: Medical data of San Diego students was compromised in a cyberattack in October. Students’ names and medical information were compromised. Officials quickly secured the network, launched an investigation and informed authorities. Additional security measures have been put in place. This attack is not the first to hit California schools in recent months.
title: San Diego Unified student medical data compromised in breach - The San Diego Union-Tribune

summary: In September 2022, Toulouse INP was the victim of a cyberattack with AvosLocker ransomware. The attack was triggered via a compromised student account and blocked the directory, authentication mechanisms and physical access capabilities to buildings. Steps have been taken to fully restore this access. The investigation is still ongoing and no claims have been made to date. The Avos franchise is known for practicing double extortion.
title: Ransomware: in September 2022, Toulouse INP was hit with AvosLocker | LeMagIT

victim: Tokyo MOU Port State Control authority
summary: Tokyo ports control authority MOU has revealed that its data was compromised for months after falling victim to a cyberattack last July. This attack caused problems with ship control data, which may have created difficulties for charterers' decision-making in the commercial market. The authority said it will increase prevention measures to avoid future attacks. In 2022, there were 24,894 inspections in the Tokyo MOU region, of which 10.5% were carried out remotely. China, Singapore and Hong Kong led the Tokyo MOU whitelist, while the United States and the
title: Tokyo MOU reveals cyber-attack compromised data | TradeWinds

summary: Bauer Gruppe and Mürwiker Gruppe, two German companies, were severely hit by cyberattacks that encrypted their servers and data, leaving them without access to their critical IT systems. The attacks resulted in estimated restoration costs of around 2.3 million euros for the Mürwiker Gruppe and 2.5 million euros for the Bauer Gruppe, which also chose not to pay the ransom and took advantage of the opportunity to restructure its businesses. Following these incidents, both companies improved their IT security, with the Mürwiker Gruppe even outsourcing its servers to an IT service provider after the de
title: The restart after the hacker attack - IHK Schleswig-Holstein

summary: The headquarters of Oil India Limited, located at Duliajan in Dibrugarh district of Assam, came under a cyber attack, leading to the shutdown of all computers and IT systems of the company. The systems have been down since Monday and efforts are underway to resolve the problem, after a virus was discovered affecting three to four computers. The extent of the damage is yet to be determined, and although OIL has faced similar problems before, this IT crisis appears to be of major severity requiring more time to resolve.
title: Oil India Headquarter Under 'Cyber Attack' || BW Businessworld

summary: The city of Kannapolis, North Carolina, suffered a cyberattack in February 2022 that disrupted its police and fire dispatch system, but failed to notify the public of the incident. City officials said there was no data breach, no ransom demand, and that utilities did not suffer significant losses. However, later revealed documents showed that the attack completely destroyed the city's network. Residents expressed differing opinions on whether they needed to be informed about the attack. The city said the insurance covered a
title: 9 Investigates: Kannapolis didn’t alert public when cyberattack knocked out police dispatch - WSOC TV

summary: Flagstar Bank paid $1 million in bitcoin to a ransomware group following a cyberattack in December 2021, a decision made by former CEO Alessandro DiNello and other stakeholders. The bank has suffered several cyberattacks in recent years, affecting millions of customers, and faces consolidated legal actions from harmed consumers. In December 2022, Flagstar was acquired by New York Community Bancorp, which recently received significant financial backing led by former United States Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin's firm.
title: Flagstar bank paid $1 million in bitcoin to a ransomware group | Crain's Detroit Business

summary: Italy's Garante Privacy has imposed fines totaling 400,000 euros on LazioCrea, Regione Lazio and Asl Roma 3 for failing to implement adequate security measures, thereby enabling a ransomware attack on the region's IT systems. July 30, 2021, in the middle of the vaccination campaign. The attack, facilitated by the introduction of Lockbit 2.0 malware via an employee's laptop, blocked access to essential health services, exposing personal data.
title: Lazio Region, ransomware attack: fines of 400 thousand euros | Wired Italy
